product_title: Olay Total Effects 7-in-1 Anti-Aging Daily Moisturizer, Fragrance Free, 1.7 Ounce
review_headline: Olay total Effects 7 in 1 anti Aging
review_body:
I like it I've been working outside all my life in the Building Trades in Central MN. I can tell you the seasons are a little extreme and when you're talking 20 below zero or 95 above we're talking tough on skin, good stuff!!

PS Standard trades joke, I haven't wore out a pair of gloves in 20 years, my hands just wont wear out!

product_title: China Glaze Nail Lacquer 0.5oz/14ml - TRANZITIONS Collection - Pick Any Color
review_body: I tried both glossy top coat and matte.  Both work well.  This is my favorite combo of the three colors I bought.  I think because there is more contrast.  The polish does what it is supposed to do -- changes color when a top coat is applied.  On the other colors, one coat sufficed.  I recommend using two with this color because it is lighter.  My only concern is with the wear of the color on actual nails since the whole nail can't get a top coat.  I understand China Glaze is one of the higher quality polishes out there so my hope is that not putting a top coat on the whole nail won't make a difference.

product_title: Luster NOW! Instant Whitening Toothpaste, Happy Mint 4 oz (113 g)

product_title: Hot Buns Dark

product_title: Instant Face, Neck and Eye Lift (Dark and Light Hair)

Had to work a bit harder for a truly close shave as these blades are not as sharp as others I have gotten in the  [[ASIN:B002Z6YXIW 125 BEST Blade Sampler FEATHER SHARK ASTRA BLUEBIRD NACET BIC LORD 7 O'Clock]]. product_title: Panasonic ES2113PC Facial Hair Trimmer for Women, with Pivoting Head and Eyebrow Trimmer Attachments, Battery-Operated

I have extreme facial hair (25 year old woman) and electrolysis costs me $75 per hour and the beautician always needed 3 hours to do my entire face. I used the Panasonic ES2113PC Pivoting Head Facial Trimmer for the first time last night and the results were just amazing, it got rid of all the hair and left my face smooth. IT REALLY WORKS!!!! I've not felt this confident about my looks in a very long time, now I can finally let my boyfriend caress my face.

Thank you Panasonic for such a great product!

product_title: Dove Nutritive Solutions Shampoo, Anti-Frizz Oil Therapy 20.4 oz
review_headline: I didn't know it was this good until I stopped using it!
review_body: I've always been a loyal customer of Dove when it comes to hair products. For some reason Dove shampoo and conditioner together always work best for my thin, dry and frizzy hair. Before I didn't really have a favorite line from Dove, I would just grab anything that's available when I'm at the grocery store. For the past few mouths I've been using the nourishing oil one and my hair just felt so silky and I also noticed less hair loss. Last week I bought the Daily Moisture shampoo&conditioner (also from Dove) and in just a couple of days my hair got a lot drier and started to fall out a lot more. I'm guessing maybe I really do need intensive treatment since my hair is so dry :( Anyway I'm trying to use up them and I can't wait to go back to this shampoo!!

product_title: SEKI EDGE SS-101- Deluxe Fingernail Clipper
review_body: I have been using these clippers for about a month now and I am so pleased with them.  I have never owned nice clippers, I have always purchased the cheapies at the gas station or local drug store.  I decided to spend a little extra to get some that will maybe last forever.  They are quality made and so SHARP!  Watch out!  My only complaint would be that they should come with a carrying case, a little pouch or something because if you just throw them in your drawer or makeup bag the next time you go digging for them you may cut yourself on those sharp blades.  I ended up finding a small little padded coin type purse to keep mine in, to protect them and me!

A little drying at first and initially it brought all my acne to the surface, but after that my skin was noticeably clearer.  I buy replacement  products through Amazon because Proactiv wants to put me on an auto-ship schedule and I don't like that.

product_title: 60cm long magenta Lolita clip on ponytails wavy cos wig RW138
review_headline: More purple than in the picture
review_body:
Overall, this is a good wig. I know the title says \\\\\magenta\\\\\" but I was looking more at the picture. I understand color differences but I wasn't expecting it to be AS purple as the picture. But I think this is a legit seller! It's so hard to buy wigs online from China but this seller is not stealing pictures or making false representations.

The wig cap feels a bit more snug than other wigs I've purchased (bodyline, gothic lolita wigs, sepia) but that's fine with me. It's pretty sturdy. It's a lot of hair in the ponytails, all the volume is in the ponytails, wearing the base alone might look a bit awkward. But that's fine. I don't know if it's heat resistant, I don't really need to apply heat to it.

Also, shipping was from China, but it came much faster than expected. There was little time between when I ordered and when it was posted (I ordered I believe on a Monday morning China time). Packaging was good, but the wig nets everything came in got a little bit tangled while unwrapping. They did a good job though to make sure everything arrived safely. Wig came in sturdy cardboard mailing envelope."

product_title: Wickedly Matte Duo Set
review_body: I love this product. The matte dries instantly and makes it look amazing. The wicked color is more red then it looks in the picture as when I got it I thought it was more of a dark purple. But it's still a good product.

review_headline: You lose the shine, but with no extention of makeup

product_title: Md Solar Sciences Mineral Screen- Gel Spf 30+ 1.76 Oz
review_body: I haven't given it the test of bright sunshine, but it leaves my face with a white look. It reminds me of the old zinc oxide, only less white than that, but still very noticeable. It's probably a great sunscreen, but I don't like the white.

product_title: L'Oreal Paris EverCreme Sulfate-Free Moisture System Cleansing Conditioner, 8.3 fl. Oz.
review_body: I just now found this product after seeing it advertised. I didn't find any of the other L'oreal hair products to be anything out of the ordinary, but the conditioning cleanser is Wen's match. I prefer it. The results are more predictable/consistant with hair being clean, shiny, and bouncy. No weighing my thin, fine hair down. My hair feels more healthy than with Wen.

product_title: Olay 4-in-1 Fragrance & Soap Free Daily Facial Cloths for Sensitive Skin 33 Count, Packaging May Vary
review_body:
I love these cloths and with the $2.00 coupon, they're a steal. I use them twice a day. I cut them in half and only use 1 cloth a day this way, so they last 66 days. I also use the cloth to rinse the soap off my face. I just rinse the cloth and squeeze out the water a couple of times until the soap is out and then use it to rinse my face. The fragrance is mild and quite nice. They haven't caused me any skin breakouts or other problems.

I buy these regularly and highly recommend to others.

product_title: Tropic Isle Jamaican Black Castor Oil 4 Oz
review_body: I love this product! It does wonders for my hair.  I like to mix it with other oils so that it can last longer, like extra vrigin olive oil and vitiamin E oil.

product_title: Leegoal(TM) Disposable Eyelash Brushes Wands Mascara Applicator 100 Pack (Black)
review_body: The wands are perfect for eyebrow shaping,tinting,and keeping mascaras sanitized. They work very well for all of our beauty needs.

product_title: Kirkland Minoxidil 5 percent Extra Strength Hair Regrowth for Men
review_headline: Just try it... and be patient
review_body:
It took almost six months before I could look at the top on my head and say, \\\\\this stuff definitely works.\\\\\" The packaging will tell you it *may* work as soon as two months, but since I had already purchased six months' worth, I figured I'd stick with it (if you do some research online, you'll see that for some guys it takes a whole year). I am very pleased with the result. My hair is not totally regrown yet, but there is very noticeable extra foliage where there used to be none. I'm hoping in a couple more months it'll be fully regrown, or almost so. In any case, I am pleased and will continue to use it. You figure it's about $5 per month... very much worth it IMO.

So, my point is, if you don't see results in two months, don't give up just yet. Also I used it AS DIRECTED, once in the morning and once in the evening every day. Some downsides: it takes FOREVER to dry, so if you think that's going to be a problem, seek alternative measures (if you sort of rub it in with your fingers, it would probably dry faster. I generally just apply drops to the top of my head and leave it at that). I experienced no adverse side effects except a very, very minor itchiness of my scalp. Nothing to cry over at all. I use \\\\\"dry scalp\\\\\" shampoo anyways, so that probably helps with this. Finally, the label will tell you it's for hair loss at the vertex. That is where I am seeing the greatest benefit. HOWEVER I do also notice a small amount of regrowth up front also.

Anyways... give it a shot, and good luck!"

product_title: Fancy Love For Women By Jessica Simpson Eau De Parfum Spray
review_body: I have been wearing this scent for a few years now and I really really love it. The scent sticks with me all day and I am ALWAYS getting complimented on it. I feel like this is a very elegant scent and its a hard one to beat. I like it the most because it os not some fruity or some obnoxious old lady smell. This is great great great and I love how I feel when I wear it!

product_title: Sunstar GUM Perioshield Oral Health Rinse - 300 Ml
review_body: I purchased this product based on a number of reviews and a clinical study.So far, I like it. This rinse has a fresh clean, dry taste, which I prefer over the sweet sticky taste of other rinses. So far, my only complaints are, I wish it came in a larger bottle and that I only seem to be able to obtain it on line. Otherwise, I would recomend this product...we will see how I do at my next cleaning!

product_title: NYX Cosmetics Eye Shadow Base
review_body: I'm just starting to experiment with makeup, and I've tried a few different bases, but this one is awesome! I am definitely going to try more NYX products. I have sensitive skin, and my skin loves this stuff! It stays on all day, and I have even passed out after a long night of concerts, with this and my eye makeup on, and it looked just as fresh the next day! That's over 24 hours, a concert in the rain, and sleeping! I would most definitely recommend it to other people. :) Well worth the money, plus some. :)

product_title: Creative Nail Design Shellac UV Color Coat Strawberry Smoothie .25oz
review_body:
Bought this color because I saw it used in a number of different layering images with other colors. I haven't yet done any layering but this is a nice shimmery pink.

This is a UV cured 'gel' polish. Done properly, a CND Shellac will last 1-3 weeks.

I have softer flexible nails - My nails need polish to keep from breaking and get longer. Acrylic kills my nails and if a salon does a generic 'off brand' gel polish, they often file my nails making them really damaged and weak so I decided to buy the CND kit & do it myself (also saving me $ in the long run.) Before Shellac I gave up on polishing my nails unless for a special event because it would peel off in a day. What a waste to spend all that time painting and drying for it to peel away the next day. I type a lot at work as well as boxing and packing stuff so I am tough on my hands. Shellac is the best system because it stays on but comes off easy WITHOUT any filing. It lasts me about 7-10 days on dark colors, because I chose to take it off when I can see growth at the cuticle. On many others, it will easily last 2 + weeks

product_title: Boo, Boo Cover, Up Pro, Healing Concealer for the Body, Medium Shade, 0.5 oz
review_body: Hi, im indian so i have dark skin and although it says medium shade, it is way too light. It does a good job at covering the acne scaring but anyone would be able to tell that im wearing something because my skin is a different color. Basically only buy this if your skin is white.

product_title: Bianchi 7500 AccuMold Paddle Holster, Black, Right Hand - Glock 17/20/21 - 18838
review_body: Holster was as presented in the description. The holster was sent  and received in a very timely manner. I would recommend this holster for anyone wanting a paddle holster that is rugged and fits the gun.

product_title: Agadir Argan Oil Moisture Masque
review_body: I love this product, makes my hair shiny and healthy. but I recommend it only for dry or damaged hair, since the product is very moisturizing, use small amounts!

product_title: Travalo Classic Refillable Perfume Spray
review_body: Small but just right for the purse or car.  Easy to fill but you must pump perfume bottle while filing.  It lasts a decent time.  Love it!!

product_title: bareMinerals ORIGINAL Foundation Broad Spectrum SPF 15
review_body:
Most eyeshadows eventually leave a dark crease, but this doesn't even after all day wear. It stays on and continues to look good all day. The shadow goes on with the slightest possible shimmer. I prefer matte shadow and was doubtful I'd like it, but it's really pretty and smooths my mature eye skin so it looks younger. The light color on the bone of your eyebrow arch opens your eyes and softens the edges of the darker color for a professional look. I'm quite taken with this shadow duo.

I've used bareMinerals powder shadows and like them but this is faster to apply and I seem to be able to control the application better. I use brushes rather than the provided application stick, but it's nice to have in the case if you're traveling and trying to minimize what your carry.

I must have a dozen shadows of various brands all nearly the same color, but will toss them now, because this does the job for me more effectively and attractively than my others. It goes on smoothly and softly and gives me a lovely finished look.

product_title: TINKLE HAIR CUTTER
review_headline: What did I ever do without it?
review_body:
I'm used to cutting my own hair, which is wavy and very thick. I've tried other razor combs, but I think this one is best, because of the longer cutting edge, the two cutting sides, and the replaceable blades. The price is the best also. The main thing is to use a light stroke and angle the comb so it doesn't take too much hair at once. Requires some getting used to and some caution. Blades are very sharp, so easy on the pressure!

I either do a sort of a loose, soft wedge with lots of fringe, a short pixie, or something in between. I start with the Flowbee vacuum-design DIY haircutter to get the basic shape. While it's still wet, I put in some conditioner and razor it carefully all over. Then I rinse and blow-dry my hair more-or-less straight with a paddle brush, put in a silky leave-in conditioner (lots), and flat iron the front. Once it's dry and flat, I can create the detail with the razor comb (without the mistakes that curls would cause), smoothing behind the ears and around the neck, shaping the crown, smoothing from back to front, and framing the face. Once the cut is complete, I can let it curl or flat iron it, either way, because it's a balanced cut.

Just the Flowbee alone will leave the hair too chunky and unnatural, at least for thick hair. It's an essential for me, though. The Flowbee site charges less than Amazon for their product. They're based in Houston and will ship by UPS.

I've repaired my boyfriend's inexpensive haircuts with this, and it works very well at taking out bumps and ridges that aren't meant to be there. I just have to be sure to put in lots of slick leave-in conditioner, so that it doesn't pull. Also need to be sure the blades are sharp. (Another good way to do this is with a comb and thinning shears--the way the barbers do it, except they use regular scissors for this. You hold the section horizontal with the comb and carefully snip at it with the shears; keep combing down and lifting/snipping until all the bumps are blended out.)

Some people say it causes split ends and frizz for them. Doesn't do this for me at all. The thinning shears will make my hair look frizzy and frazzled if I'm not careful (so I rarely use them on myself), but the razor combs never do that to me.

Good luck to you, and I hope this helps. It sure saves money, once you're used to it. Also, you'll notice more easily the mistakes a hairdresser makes if you know how to cut your own. You'll want to continue giving yourself that special attention that is so expensive at a salon.l the bumps are blended out.)

Some people say it causes split ends and frizz for them. Doesn't do this for me at all. The thinning shears will make my hair look frizzy and frazzled if I'm not careful (so I rarely use them on myself), but the razor combs never do that to me.

Good luck to you, and I hope this helps. It sure saves money, once you're used to it. Also, you'll notice more easily the mistakes a hairdresser makes if you know how to cut your own. You'll want to continue giving yourself that special attention that is so expensive at a salon.

product_title: Scruples Smooth Out Shampoo, 12 Fluid Ounce
review_body: Merchant falsely advertised that shampoo was LITER size (33 oz) and I received only 12 oz bottles.  Monetarily that means with buying 5 liter bottles and receiving 5 12 oz bottles that I am now paying almost 3 TIMES the price per ounce.  Merchant wouldn't honor price advertised on a per ounce basis and told me to return them.  HUGE INCONVENIENCE WITH NO COMPROMISE FOR THEIR INCORRECT DESCRIPTION!!!!

product_title: 36W Nail UV Lamp Acrylic Gel Curing Light Timer Dryer Equipment Pink
review_body: I bought this to use with my CND Shellac Polish. It's real simple to use and easy to put together. I kind of wish there was a fan with it. But it worked great with my polish.

product_title: Kanekalon Jumbo Braid
review_body: I was a bit scared what it would like once I would receive it but now I am relieved. It corresponds to the description and the color is good :).However I wish they would put more braid in the packs. :(

product_title: Orajel Toddler Training Toothpaste, Thomas & Friends, Tooty Fruity Flavor
review_headline: DO you know what's in it ???
review_body: We raise our kids organic, and we wanted a training toothpaste fluoride free... My wife came back from shopping with this \\\\\safe if swallowed-fluoride free\\\\\" toothpaste with Thomas the train on it...  I just wasn't ready for what was this toothpaste made of...Sorbitol !!!  Ethylene Glycol (Ethylene glycol, is commonly used in acrylic paints, brake fluid, antifreeze, tile grout, primer, sealant paste, floor polish, tyre sealant and shoe polish. Oh yes.......and it's also used in some \\\\\"smoothing lotions\\\\\" and \\\\\"firming moisturizer\\\\\"! ) , Simethicone (anti gas agent), so the side effects of Sorbitol (bloating, gas tar like stools, diarrea, etc can be offset), Sodium saccharin (petroleum based sweetner - 500x sweeter than sugar- used in diet sodas, and well known to cause and facilitate cancer- cancer cells feed of the molecules of saccharin-)... This toothpaste should bare a warning label, for the parents to be aware of the chemicals their toddler will be swallowing (since we all know how much toothpaste kids swallow when TRAINING... Hence the \\\\\"really cool flavors\\\\\" for kids, so they can really load up on their chemicals intake before they grow. VERY DISAPPOINTED, WILL FIND ANOTHER TOOTHPASTE."

product_title: Braun Clean & Renew Frustration Free Refill Cartridges CCR 4  Refills
review_headline: Expensive but can be made to last a *long* time
review_body:
These are expensive. If you clean the razor every use, as Braun recommends, you'll get maybe 30 cleanings and be done with a single refill in about one month. Instead, I use the clean cycle only once a week, and stopper the refills in between to prevent evaporation. Before you clean the razor, get as much hair out of it as you can (e.g. by *carefully* running it under water and/or using a brush). This will keep the refill from being filled with hair. Then you use the cleaning cycle as normal.

After cleaning is done, the razor will be free of hair and have a nice scent. I've had my starter cartridge since December 2011, and it still shows up green when I put it in the system.

product_title: Glycoderma Complete Care System Revitalizing Facial Cream (25% Glycolic Acid)
review_body: So far this is an ok product. I have to agree with another reviewer on the scent. I usually don't have a problem with different scents, but I am uncomfortable when it is lotion for the face. For me the smell seems to linger on throughout the day. So far though it has not caused my skin to break out compared to other products that are fragranced. It seems to tighten my skin, but I expected more of a tingly sensation using this product due to it supposedly having 25% glycolic acid. I have another brand of lotion with 12% glycolic acid that I notice working more than this product. Not sure what to think about that. Other than that it is ok, not sure if I will order it again. I would like the product so much more if they would take out the fragrance.

product_title: Supersmile Professional Whitening Toothpaste
review_body: This brand is our favorite because teeth feel so much cleaner. The baking soda is non abrasive cleaner. However, this flavor is more of a cloves taste than cinnamon. Not my favorite flavor but certainly is a burst of flavor.

product_title: amazing grace | gift set | philosophy
review_body: This is a very light clean scent. Anyone purchasing this needs to know that up front. This a scent people won't catch unless they're next to you, and isn't that nice? Also the fragrance changes once it dries down, so be patient. It's worth it! Oh yeah, I bought this set for myself and it's adorable!

product_title: SHANY Nail Art Set (24 Famous Colors Nail Art Polish, Nail Art Decoration)
review_body: I have been very happy with this purchase. You get a lot of colors and a holder for a great price! It's a worth it purchase if you are unsure.

product_title: Physicians Formula Eye Booster 2-in-1 Lash Boosting Eyeliner + Serum
review_body: I purchased this liner because people advised it may grow your lashes.  It has not grown my lashes, but the liner is jet black and ultra fine.  i do not like thick lines.  This is not a felt tip, but a very fine brush and its perfect.  I would recommend this product.

product_title: Lusa Organics Booty Balm - All Natural Organic Ingredients Soothe Sore Baby Bottoms Including Diaper Rash, Cuts, Scrapes, Sunburn, and Windburn - 1.75 oz
review_body: I know all babies are different, and I think my baby might have particularly sensitive skin, but I used this twice and both times her slightly red bottom tuned BRIGHT red- the BootyBalm made it worse!! The stuff smells divine, but that's about it. Plus it is REALLY expensive! It's nice that it can be used with my cloth diapers (which is why I bought it) but I will have to stick with my disposable diapers and Desitin when we get diaper rash from now on.

product_title: Millenium Tanning New Paint It Black Auto-Darkening Dark Tanning Lotion, 50X, 13.5 Ounce
review_body: This stuff really is great for the price, love the smell and texture.. It really gets you hard VERY quickly I could tell after my first use! Not greasy and no unpleasant after tanning smell! Def worth 13 dollars ;)

product_title: Gelish Soak Off Gel Nail Polish
review_body: This color looks like a really pretty shimmery white.  It is NOT.  It is a light pink.  I am VERY DISAPPOINTED and would love to return it but this seller does not accept returns.  I bought this color specifically to do a french manicure with shimmery white tips, not pink.

product_title: The Tongue Cleaner
review_body: I read about tongue scrapers on Reddit.  Did some research and ordered this baby.  Once you get one of these, you'll never regret it.  My mouth never felt so clean.  Perfect width and just enough edge to scrape hard, but not too hard.  I recommend everyone has one of these.  Buy one, now.

product_title: My Life For Women By Mary J. Blige Eau De Parfum Spray
review_body: I almost bought this on a shopping network when I was watching one day and they were talking about how beautiful it smelled. I was intrigued. At that time, the only place I could find it was there and it was quite pricey but if it's good, I don't mind it being expensive.  I just was too afraid to try without smelling it first.  Glad I didn't.  I was in the local drugstore the other day and low and behold there it was, much cheaper.  I sniffed and almost gagged. It is very cheap smelling, like something that a teenager or a stupid man who buys a gift at the last second and has to purchase at the corner drugstore might pick up.  YUK.  That's all I can say.  Reminds me of scents from a company that used to go door-to-door with their catalog.  Remember the AV0N lady? Well, there you go!

product_title: Philips Sonicare Flexcare & Healthy White Travel Charger Model Hx6100 - Bulk Package
review_body:
There's not much to report about this device, save that it functions as advertised.

The integrated mains cable might ideally be a little longer (it's about 100cm) for the charging environment in our bathrooms, but for many users it will be fine. The footprint of the base is smaller than that of the original charger supplied by Philips with the Sonicare brush, which means it's a slightly less stable platform; on the other hand, you save some worktop space.

Overall, `it does what it says on the tin'.

product_title: Victoria's Secret Garden Vanilla Lace Hydrating Body Lotion 8.4 fl oz (250 ml)
review_body: fast delivery good product, got it as a christmas stuffer. My wife always seems to use this lotion, so thats why I got it for her. Delivery was quick and I live in Hawaii.

product_title: Clubman Moustache Wax
review_body: I had very high hopes for this but it let me down hold is not great getting the right amount is hard if you put to much it leave white residue not enough hold will not last I'm sticking with firehouse wax from here on

product_title: CoverGirl Continuous Color Lipstick,Toasted Almond 795 0.13 oz (3 g)
review_body: Since I could not post that the product is too pricey at the recently raised price I'm going to lie and say it is nicely priced so I will not get an e-mail telling me my review could not be posted because I put truth, and was well within all guidelines with what my review said before...  I gues you have to say something good to get a review posted?  SAD

product_title: Anna Sui Anna Sui Loose Powder - # 200, .88 oz
review_body: This is very nice item.This product is very cost-effective, practical, perfect packaging, very fast arrival  just good good good good good good good

product_title: OPI Mini Muppets Set
review_headline: Great way to sample these fun colors!  Terrific gift idea!
review_body:
The package shown in Amazon's picture has the colors in the wrong order and so they are mis-labelled:
* \\\\\Wocka-wocka\\\\\" is in the correct slot and is an opaque red/magenta.
* \\\\\"Designer...de Better!\\\\\" is a silver paint with a smattering of pink glitter. It's the second from the left in the picture shown. \\\\\"Designer...de-better!\\\\\" is a denser glitter coat as opposed to the sparkle polishes in the rest of the Muppets collection (e.g., \\\\\"Rainbow Connection\\\\\", \\\\\"Fresh Frog of Bel Air\\\\\"). It is nearly opaque with one coat and fully opaque with two.
* \\\\\"Excuse moi\\\\\" is incorrectly slotted in the picture; it's actually the pink glitter color shown in the far right in the picture. \\\\\"Excuse moi\\\\\" is pink paint with pink glitter throughout. It is nearly opaque with one coat and fully opaque with two, like \\\\\"Designer...de Better!\\\\\".
* Finally, \\\\\"Warm & Fozzie\\\\\" is a rich and light brown color with gold and brown glitter. It's the third from the left (or second from the right) in the picture shown.

As far as the colors they picked for this mini-collection, I'm actually a little disappointed. The Muppets collection includes several sparkle coats that are awesome, specifically [[ASIN:B005R4TO6K Rainbow Connection]], [[ASIN:B002IFHVMA Fresh Frog of Bel Air]], [[ASIN:B002HXX7WQ Gone Gonzo!]], [[ASIN:B005RFI1YK Divine Swine]], and [[ASIN:B005SH0PLE Gettin' Miss Piggy with It]]. Of the group of colors in this mini-collection, I like \\\\\"Warm & Fozzie\\\\\" and \\\\\"Designer...de Better!\\\\\" the best. A layer of any of the sparkle coats over \\\\\"Designer...de Better!\\\\\" is really pretty.

If you're the kind of person that constantly wants a new nail color, the mini-collections by OPI (like this one) are perfect. If you're like me, you rarely use a bottle of nail polish more than once or twice. In that case, you'll have plenty in each of these bottles. I have yet to make one of them run out. The one complaint I have is that the applicator brush in the mini-bottles is not the same level of quality as OPI's brushes usually are. What I suggest is, before you throw away an old bottle of OPI, take out the brush and clean it thoroughly with acetone. Then, you can use that brush with your mini-bottles and just clean it with nail polish remover after each use. That way you can get the full coverage of the normal OPI brush while using your (cheaper) mini-polishes.

For holiday gifts, it's a great idea to buy these mini-collections and break them up to distribute to a group or use as stocking stuffers. I do that every year for the women in our family, and we all trade the colors around until we each have ones we like. Keep in mind, though, that the individual mini bottles are not labelled, so people won't know what color they have. You might want to use a gift tag to label the bottles for your recipients in that case.PI's brushes usually are. What I suggest is, before you throw away an old bottle of OPI, take out the brush and clean it thoroughly with acetone. Then, you can use that brush with your mini-bottles and just clean it with nail polish remover after each use. That way you can get the full coverage of the normal OPI brush while using your (cheaper) mini-polishes. For holiday gifts, it's a great idea to buy these mini-collections and break them up to distribute to a group or use as stocking stuffers. I do that every year for the women in our family, and we all trade the colors around until we each have ones we like. Keep in mind, though, that the individual mini bottles are not labelled, so people won't know what color they have. You might want to use a gift tag to label the bottles for your recipients in that case."

product_title: Midnight in Paris Cologne by Van Cleef & Arpels for men Colognes
review_body: When I received the cologne, it wasn't what I expected. It has grown on me now, and my wife loves it. It's a deferent kind of smell, but it's really ok!!!

product_title: Manic Panic Semi- Permanent Hair Dye Electric Lava
review_body: It arrived on time, no damage to the product, and it was exactly what I ordered. Thank you so much for the service. I must warn people using manic panic, it doesn't last very long, but its great for color without long term commitment.

product_title: Professional Lomansa Eyelash Wave Lotion Kit with Eye Putty Glue
review_body: In my area there aren't any places that have eyelash perm available in my area and my eyelashes don't keep curl with an eyelash curler at all! So I bought this kit and did it myself, of course extremely careful not to get it in the eye. Everyone loves my eyelashes and compliments me on them! Also a great price...

product_title: Kryolan Cake Eye Liner 5321 Black 4g 0.15 Oz
review_body: I've used many different cake eyeliners, as they are my eyeliner application preference.  Laura Mercier used to have a great cake eyeliner.  Then they updated and ruined their formula and it no longer works well with water to liquify the product.  You now apparently have to buy LM's separate sealer.  Forget that!  I've used Kryolan's cake eyeliners for a long time.  The black is a true, rich jet black.  Mixed with water, it applies creamy and beautifully.  It wears until I take it off.  It's everything that Laura Mercier's used to be.  The package is large and the product lasts a very long time.  I also have Kryolan's cake in brown, but am not as thrilled with its color because it's a very ashy brown.  I wish they'd make it richer.  But the black is amazing.

product_title: Shahnaz Husain Shaeyes Herbal Kohl (kajal), 2gm
review_body: I come from Indian subcontinent, a place where kohl kajal is very popular among ladies.  After coming to US, I looked for one for a long time and couldn't find one.  So I had to make the eye pencils work.  I was delighted to find this kohl style kajal on Amazon and bought one right away.  It took some time (about 2.5 weeks) to arrive but I am loving it so far.  It gives a thick and dark line in lower eye; I personally don't like to use it on the lid since t fails to achieve a thin line.

product_title: Color Contact Lenses (Sugar Gray)
review_body: I'm not sure how to order what color I want, it says to tell you by email but your email is not included. I already ordered a pair and I wish to receive them in brown.

product_title: The Seaweed Bath Co. Body Wash
review_body: I became familiar with this line of bath and moisturizing products at Expo East almost a year ago. I travel all the time and the aiplane air drys out my skin regardless of how much water I drink. I originally used the bath products because my skin was severely dry. These seaweed baths were great and the effects lasted two days. The problem was that on the road , my hotel room either had no bath tub or I was not comfortable sitting in it. This forced me to try the seaweed body wash and the body butters, both of which I love. I am in my 50's and no other products I have tried come close to this line. Both the butters and the body wash keep my skin moisturized for about 12 hours. Well done.[[ASIN:B0013EBM22 Seaweed Bath Salt]]

product_title: GODEFROY Instant Eyebrow Tint Medium Brown
review_body:
I naturally have medium brown hair and light brown eyebrows. I have been darkening them with gels and pencils for years, and have always been self conscious at the pool, etc. Luckily after finding this product-not anymore. This has been extremely helpful. I am no longer worried about going in public without \\\\\my eyebrows on,\\\\\" and not to mention the time it saves me time every day (sometimes multiple times) dealing with them. I think the eyebrows are the most important part of your face, and I feel so much better to be able to get up and go.

I would recommend this product to anyone who has to deal with the burden of using gels, pencils, or shadows on a daily basis. I will say that the directions say to leave it on each eyebrow for two minutes, but I leave it on for four. My eyebrows are pretty dark afterwards for about a day and a half, but I get longer use out of each application that way. Also, the box says it lasts six weeks, but with leaving it on for four minutes, I get about a week and a half, or close to two weeks wear out of an application. I also followed the advice of another reviewer and put chapstick on the skin around my eyebrows to keep from staining my skin. All in all, it takes me about 15 minutes tops every other week or so to dye my brows with this product, which seems a lot better than the ten minutes a day I spent coloring them in.

I hope this review is helpful. I just ordered the \\\\\"Godefroy Double Lash & Brow Treatment\\\\\" since I love the eyebrow tint so much, so I will be writing a review about it after I give that product a go."

product_title: Philips Norelco SensoTouch 3D Electric Razor
review_body: Used worse, however this shaver is far from impressive, especially considering how much it costs. A standard razorhead could do the job much faster and effectively.  Unless you plan to use this thing for 5 or more years, and spend 20 minutes each time you want to fully shave your face, you will regret buying it.

product_title: Shiseido Tsubaki Shining Conditioner with Tsubaki Oil EX - 220ml
review_body: i randomly picked this up not knowing it was supposed to be really good for hair, but after just one use, i could already tell a difference in the softness of my hair! most reviews that claim change after one use don't hold true, but this one completely did. the conditioner smells amazing, and for the short time i've been using it, it's been great.

product_title: Clarisonic Pro Professional 4-Speed Skin Care System, White
review_body: Terrific invention.  I've noticed a distinct clarifying, smoothing trend.  Upper lip wrinkles have diminished.  This brings  hope to those who are enduring the cruel and relentless aging process.     God, I love science..........     Don't mess around.  Buy the pro model.  There's a reason it costs more.  It works better.

product_title: Now Foods Lanolin Pure,
review_body:
My wife and I decided to try 100% pure lanolin as our baby kept getting rashes even with Desitin. We have been amazed at the versatility of uses for this product - 1) ointment for babies' bottoms; 2) moisturizer for the hands, face, feet, anywhere; 3) great moisturizer for the eyelids and around the eyes in general.... At first I was a little \\\\\sheepish\\\\\" (ha ha!) about smelling like a sheep. The stuff does smell a little like sheep but we have actually grown to like the smell well enough. It is a natural, light smell. It does not leave any smell on your clothes or face. For instance, I put the moisturizer all over my face before going to bed at night. In the morning, my face feels good and not greasy. I believe this is because the lanolin absorbs so well into the skin. Also, the lanolin leaves no lasting smell on your clothes, sheets, etc.

We have been using pure lanolin for our babies' bottoms for over 4 months now, and they have less rashes. And we have recently ordered 4 more bottles. We also are users of Eucerin, Aquaphor, and good old petroleum jelly but this pure lanolin is much better for moisturizing and getting rid of dryness. I use aquaphor before going out during the day b/c I don't want to smell \\\\\"sheep-y\\\\\". My wife loves the stuff and even loves the smell so she has no issues going out with it on....

Another thing.... sometimes when my skin feels itchy (i.e. possibly from dryness), I apply the lanolin and this soothes the itch. Try this product. It's great!"

product_title: Revlon Precision Lash Adhesive
review_body: As a bellydancer I frequently wear false eyelashes and was saddened upon developing a latex allergy since almost all lash adhesives are latex based. There is the single lash adhesive, but it dries hard and sharp and is difficult and painful to remove. When I stumbled upon this product, my problem was solved! This is just as flexible as traditional latex based adhesive, and has excellent hold (I've fallen asleep in makeup and my lashes were still secure the next day even after sleeping in them) but is entirely latex free. Even better, because of the narrow application brush, its a snap to apply with no mess and no waste. You simply paint the edge of the lash strip with a thin line of adhesive, let it get tacky and apply.  Latex allergic lash weareres rejoice--there is this fantastic product around to solve your adhesive needs!

product_title: Remington Wet 2 Straight Slim Plate Wet/Dry Straightening Iron
review_body: This is the best flat iron! I've been telling everyone about it. I don't need a blow dryer anymore. Thank You!

product_title: Kiss My Face Peaches & Creme Moisturizer with 8% Alpha Hydroxy Acids, 4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)
review_body: Omg!  I love this product.  The smell is fresh and invigorating.  It's gentle enough to use everyday, and the price is too.  Since I started using it people have been commenting on how great my skin looks.

product_title: Hot Tools Ionic Anti-Static Professional Dryer - Model # 1035 - Black/purple Hair Dryer For Unisex
review_body: My hair is superfine, and in the winter when it gets all staticky it makes me nuts.  I wind up putting it in a ponytail most of the time because I can't stand the static.  Aveda used to make a wonderful product that really took that static out but they don't make it anymore and none of the others I tried worked either.  I really didn't think a blow dryer could make a difference, and I've only used this a few times since I got it (and I use it with the diffuser on it so I'm not sure if that makes a difference or not) but it REALLY doesn't leave my hair with any static.  Mind you, it doesn't take all the frizz out of my hair (it starts off looking just fine but kind of frizzes as the day wears on) but I bought it for the anti-static, and I'm really pleased with that aspect of it.

product_title: Jerdon Lighted Makeup Mirror with 5x Magnification, White Finish
review_body: I got this for my daughter in college.  After having it for less than 3 months she called and said it wouldn't work.  Of course, I can't return it- can't even contact the seller.  I do not recommend this product- might as well just shred the money and get a flashlight.

product_title: Panasonic ER421KC Ear and Nose Trimmer with Grooming Light, Wet Dry Convenient
review_body: Works pretty well - the light is not usefull to me at all but the cutting blade does an adequate job.  There might be a better one out there but not for the price.

product_title: Oral-B Professional Care 1000 Power Toothbrush
review_headline: Great but, get the cheaper one. Just as good.
review_body:
Do you have migraines or Meniere's disease or just have a sensitive head? Don't get any of the pulsating Oral B brushes. They will just make you nauseous or trigger a headache.

I have used the classic Oral B electric brush for many years. A fantastic simple white design by Braun of Germany - since discontinued after Braun was bought by an American company. Now I have the simple low end non pulsing model. Essentially the same guts and head as the classic but with an ugly, over stylized, blue body.

When the battery started to die on my classic model, I picked up a pulsating Oral B. It is really banging away at your teeth and does as good a job as the non pulsatinging. But it vibrates your jaw and skull like, well, a vibrating electric tooth brush! After a month, it was just too much for me. I went back to the dieing battery original, but soon got its replacement as a gift.

The verdict: I'm in my 40s and I've had about 6 different dentists (moving from job to job) in 5 different states. One was a professor at a dental college. After each visit, they all proclaim my teeth are in excellent shape. I use the cheapest Oral B electric brush (non pulsating) in the morning and before bed with Colgate Total. I also floss just one time before bed and use the Crest rinse for night time. I get them cleaned every 6-9 months.

Save your money and get the cheapest Oral B electric toothbrush. I think it is on sale sometimes for about $10.

product_title: Clarisonic Mia Sonic Skin Cleansing System, Pink
review_body: I am in my mid 30's and have fought with sporadic acne (just on my chin) for the past 10 years. I get facials - it gets worse. My skin is dry, so all the \\\\\acne\\\\\" medicated soaps make things awful. I purchased the Clarisonic Mia and have used it every day for about two months - guess what? Totally clear skin. I haven't changed face wash, lotion - nothing else in my usual routine has changed, I just started using the Mia. I went to the Clinique counter this weekend and the saleswoman remarked at how clear and smooth my skin was. It is for faces what Sonicare is to teeth! Wonderful!"

product_title: Now Foods, Grape Seed Oil
review_body: i love this product but i would not buy it again because the description or bottle doesn't say whether it is expeller pressed or pressed with hexane or another chemical. The other now product oils that are expeller pressed brag about it, and this one doesn't mention it which makes me curious.

product_title: Oral-B Precision Clean Electric Toothbrush Replacement Brush Heads Refill
review_headline: Oral B Precision 3 pack head refill
review_body: These brushes are very hard to find.  Contacted Oral B and they suggested I try Amazon, which I did  Again, I had a difficult time finding them at a drug store or online.  Have been using these brush heads for years and was delighted to see you carried the product.

product_title: CoverGirl & Olay Simply Ageless Foundation 230
review_body: I have tried many cream to conceal the circles under my eyes. This is my favorite.  It brightens well and gives me a more wide-awake look.  I received it as a free sample by being a Bzz agent, and it came just at a time when I really needed it.  It passed the test by helping me out during a time of little sleep. It doesn't look at all cakey, dry or oily, it's just right.

product_title: Elgin Archxerciser Foot Exerciser - Original
review_body: A simple practical product that is efficient for strengthening the arch. Sure, a person can probably achieve the same results by using a towel and scrunching it up with your toes, and then re-positioning the towel, etc. The Archxerciser, though, makes doing this exercise a lot simpler and efficient. My physiotherapist understood immediately the value of this product and immediatelyl took down the information about it.

product_title: Adovia Acne Soap - All Natural Acne Relief (From Dead Sea Mineral Mud)
review_body: I received the soap 3 days ago, and I can already see results.  The smaller pimples I had are gone, while the bigger ones are significantly smaller.  The thing I like the most about the soap is that it doesn't dry your skin (I had been using salicylic acid/benzoyl peroxide products, and they cause my skin to become very dry and scaly).  The only downside I can think of regarding the soap is that its scent isn't the most pleasant (reminds me a little of how play-doh smells), but this isn't an issue--the smell doesn't linger, and the effectiveness of the soap is, after all, the most important aspect!

product_title: Tree Hut Shea Body Lotion, Original Shea, 8-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)
review_body: I searched high and low for this product.  It is the best body lotion my mother loves it.

product_title: PMT Premium Portable Ultrasound Machine - US-1000
review_body: This product just doesn't seem to be powerful enough to really make much of an impact on lower or upper back pain.  I would say that if I buy again it will be a more expensive, more professional item.  Just doesn't seem worth the price.

product_title: Posner Cover Creme .5 oz. Medium/Deep
review_body: All I have to say is everyone is different. So what works for one person may not work for another. I am a caramel complexion and have struggled with acne since the age of 12. Acne has left black scars on my face....not brown spots....BLACK SPOTS. Going out in public without makeup is so embarrassing. I got some of this concealer because of the girls face on the box. I figured if it didn't work I would just take it back!   Once I opened the pot:  *I swirled a fair amount onto my concealer brush (CVS has great brushes)  *Dabbed the concealer onto the black spots until they disappeared   *THENNNN...I use my MAC concealer to BLEND the outsides of the Posner application into my skin (I had to figure out something to do with it...to expesive to throw away)  *Then I apply my foundation to the rest of my face as normal  *When I get to the spots that have concealer I simply DAB...JUST DAB the foundation over this area to keep from wiping off the concealer  *Then I apply my powder as normal.   My skin is FLAWLESS!!!!  Hope if works for you!

product_title: PHYTO Phytovolume Actif Volumizer Spray, Fine & Limp Hair 4.22 fl oz (125 ml)
review_headline: for anyone with fine hair, this is a great product
review_body: I have very fine hair and this product makes my hair fuller and thicker looking, I love it!

product_title: Philips Sonicare HX6311/02 Sonicare for Kids Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush
review_headline: Great toothbrush for my little one!
review_body: My 4-year-old daughter has always HATED brushing her teeth.  We tried every toothbrush out there, and every toothpaste, too, but she still hated it, and it was a battle every night to get it done.    And then we bought the Sonicare for kids, and now she loves to brush her teeth.  She adores the pacing music, and says it tickles when we brush her teeth.  I love the size of the brush head (it's nice and small for her little mouth), and how easy it is to maneuver the brush for her.  And her dentist assures me it will help with the horrible stains she gets on her teeth because of her asthma medications.    My husband was really skeptical about this toothbrush, but I'm glad I ignored him.  I would recommend it to anyone!

product_title: Vidal Sassoon Professional Ion Molecular Steam Setter Model #Vs330
review_headline: Best Steam Setter I've Had, But...
review_body:
I've been using steam setters for over ten years, and the Vidal Sassoon is the better of the two brands I've used. However, the main complaint I have about steam setters, including this one, is that they don't last for more than a year or two. I used to be OK with that when they were about half the price, but, with what I consider to be an exhorbitant price, it will get very expensive when I have to replace this one. I don't quite understand what makes these things so expensive.

Also, I'd like to be able to buy just the unit,because with my short hair, I can't even use most of the rollers that come with it. In fact, I have to go online to find the smallest rollers they have.

All that being said, I still like this method of doing hair because it really does work. So, I guess I'll continue to bite the bullet and buy another one when this one dies on me.

product_title: Undercover Angel Firming Moisturizer Fresh Clean 20 Oz
review_body: this lotion smells great and really hydrates your skin while extending your tan as well!

product_title: Tussy Anti-Perspirant Deodorant Roll-On Original, Fresh Spice 1.70 oz
review_body: The product is one that I have used for awhile, however I e-mailed the company that sent me the Tussy, regarding the price [I think that they may have overcharged me for the six 1.7 oz containers] up to this date they have not responded !!!. Once I get a response from them, I can give an updated review [more than likely a higher star rating]!  Manuel Garcia Jr.

product_title: Earth Therapeutics Terry Covered Bath Pillow Implements
review_headline: Very comfortable, good quality bath pillow
review_body: Lovely bath pillow, with 4 suction pads behind, the terry material is part of the pillow, not a cover, which is great. It is a nice size, supports your shoulders as well as your neck. There is a noticeable medium sized logo which is not shown in the photo. It says Earth Therapeutics. It is sewn in a very contrasting white colour on the terry cloth across the front of the pillow near the top.

product_title: Covet Perfume by Sarah Jessica Parker for women Personal Fragrances
review_body: This is such a wonderful, mild perfume.  Tucci has been a good seller to me so far and I am happy to buy from them again.

product_title: Tweezerman Ingrown Hair Splintertweeze
review_headline: Exactly what we were looking for!
review_body: We've purchased several so-called needle-tipped tweezers; always to come away disappointed.  Either the tips didn't meet perfectly or were too wide (not a true needle-tip) or they were flimzy.  This is not a good situation to be in when you're attempting to pull a tiny glass-shard out of your foot as was the case with me recently.  The shard was so tiny my wife couldn't even see it but I sure could feel it!  We had a lousy set of tweezers and gave up with them she had to come up with a \\\\\plan B\\\\\".  THIS pair, however, is perfectly aligned, needle-tipped and strong.  I definitely recommend this model/brand tweezer and will be revisiting Tweezerman for our future Tweezing needs as well.  A little more costly but, alas, sometimes you need to \\\\\"get what you pay for\\\\\"."

product_title: Panasonic ES2067W EpliglideULTRA Epliator with 360 Degree Triple Sprinning Heads, Green
review_body: I had high expectations, but disappointed overall:  - hair removal takes much, much longer than with a simple, one (longer) spinning head epilator - this is due to the short spinning heads.  - hair stuck in the spinning head which is very hard to remove (it's also due to the small head)    Pros:  - in wet application the hair removal is surprisingly painless (which is very good!!!)  - no red dots after wet hair removal    I gave 3 stars, because the time is really an issue for me

product_title: Carols Daughter Almond Cookie Eau de Toilette 2fl.oz
review_body: you've got to be kidding me. Almond cookie, smelled more like scented toilet paper and Jean Nate that never wears off. Don't be fooled by the other reviews.

product_title: Truefitt & Hill Ultimate Comfort Shaving Cream, 6.7-Ounces
review_body: This is a great shaving cream.  It generates a nice thick slick foam.  A little goes a long way.

product_title: bareMinerals Eye Shadow 0.57g
review_body: I like this product although it can be tough to put on --- either too much or too little, so beware! A good brush is key to a good application.   It does last all day and is a very complementary color, usually.

product_title: Waterpik Waterpik Ultra Dental Water Jet Flosser Wp-100
review_body: This waterpik is an excellent choice.  It have several attachments, and is great for someone with braces.  You can control not only the water use but also the water pressure with a quick turn of the dial.

product_title: In The Nude Bath Melt by LUSH
review_body: Nice fragrance and skin softening properties but not much for the money. I liked it but expected more. It's a small bar and a one time use thing. I enjoy the bombs more and can't wait to try the soap.

product_title: Aquaphor Healing Ointment, 14 oz (396 g) (Pack of 2)
review_body: I love this stuff... works for EVERYTHING>.. I use the regular aquaphor for myself and it even helped with my stretchmarks and my dry skin on my tummy after my csection... it helps with cuts and scrapes too... good stuff.. worth the price!!

product_title: Fabulous Origami Boxes
review_body:
This delightful origami book features a collection of designs by Tomoko Fuse which have been published elsewhere in her Japanese language books but which appear here accompanied by English text. As always Miss Fuse's boxes are beautifully finished both inside and out and choosing the correct paper can add a great deal to the quality of the finished product.

These little boxes consist of a number of sheets of paper slotted together to form each part and some are really not that easy to do. The flower box and some of the other decorative tops are quite tricky to figure out and absolute accuracy is required in the folding. Having said this I have made most of the boxes in the book and the instructions are in Miss Fuse's clear and easy to follow style. All of the boxes are made up and photographed clearly in the book, both in a separate sumptuous gallery section and in black and white photographs alongside the instructions.

I would not recommend this book for a complete beginner but someone who has done some folding and has mastered the basic models should be able to manage and enjoy making most of the items in it.

product_title: What the Buddha Taught: Revised and Expanded Edition with Texts from Suttas and Dhammapada
review_body: This book is an excellent introduction to Buddhism.  I found it VERY interesting.

product_title: The Lord of the Rings: 50th Anniversary, One Vol. Edition
review_body:
Though Tolkien was not the first or most critically-acclaimed fantasy writer, he remains the most beloved and influential, even though \\\\\Lord of the Rings\\\\\" is decades old. Now with the epic movie trilogy based on this book, new waves of readers are discovering the unique power of the \\\\\"Lord of the Rings.\\\\\" It has quietly created the fantasy genre as we know it, set the tone for most fantasy ever since, topped many \\\\\"best book\\\\\" polls, and helped spawn such entertainment phenomena as \\\\\"Star Wars.\\\\\"

Following up on events in \\\\\"The Hobbit,\\\\\" \\\\\"The Fellowship of the Ring\\\\\" stars the quiet, good-natured hobbit Frodo Baggins, who has inherited a golden Ring that allows its user to become invisible. But his friend, Gandalf the wizard, informs Frodo that the Ring is really the Ring of Power, a tiny invulnerable token that the demonic Dark Lord Sauron has poured his essence and power into. And if Sauron can regain the Ring, he will be able to conquer Middle-Earth. Aghast, Frodo joins a fellowship of Elves, Dwarves, Hobbits, Men and a wizard, to go to the one place where the Ring can be destroyed: Mount Doom.

\\\\\"The Two Towers\\\\\" begins directly after \\\\\"Fellowship,\\\\\" after Frodo Baggins flees with his friend Sam into Mordor, with no one to protect them. His cousins Merry and Pippin are kidnapped by orcs from the renegade wizard Saruman. Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli begin a frenetic search for the hobbits, and receive unexpected help from unlikely allies. Meanwhile, the Ring weighs more heavily on Frodo, as he is forced to get help from one of the people he most despised: the Ring's slave Gollum.

\\\\\"Return of the King\\\\\" brings the trilogy to an action-packed, slam-bang and ultimately poignant finale. Sam barely rescues Frodo from Sauron's orcs, and the two resume their journey to Mount Doom, barely escaping Sauron's forces. As Aragorn leads the desperate battle against Sauron's armies at the city of Minas Tirith, Frodo falls increasingly under the seductive spell of the Ring.

\\\\\"Lord of the Rings\\\\\" is indeed a powerful book, speaking to virtually everyone who has read it. J.R.R. Tolkien drew from legends and myths, ranging from the ancient Norse mythology to more recent legends, mingled with his love of the British country folk and his Roman Catholic beliefs. Though there are no direct linkages or lessons in the trilogy, Tolkien probably drew on his experiences in World War I for the ravaged battlefields and breakneck action sequences. His beliefs are equally misty but present: they fueled the ethics of the good guys, the fall of formerly-good wizard Saruman, and the themes of temptation, redemption, evil and good that run through every character.

Frodo Baggins is an everyman hero, who dreams of adventure but begins to treasure the simple, boring life that he had once he is deprived of it. His deteriotation is saddening, all the more so because he is aware of it. Sam Gamgee is his loyal gardener, a shy young hobbit who grows in confidence and courage. Gandalf is the quintessential wizard -- crabby, kindly, powerful, with a hidden unique streak that elevates him over the usual. Merry and Pippin start out a bit flaky, but are matured by their harrowing experiences. Aragorn is noble, kind, kingly, and intelligent, but with darker streaks in his personality that make him ultimately human. Legolas the elf and Gimli the dwarf initially grate on each other, but overcome their prejudices to become close friends.

Tolkien's writing is evocative and descriptive, though not to extremes; Mordor, for example, is best described through the way that Sam and Frodo react to it. The dialogue can range from goofy and hilarious to solemn and archaic, or to some combination of the two. And the pacing is gradual but necessary -- readers with short attention spans won't be able to handle this story. If they can handle sprawling, epic tales, then probably they can.

Even after all the years, J.R.R. Tolkien's \\\\\"Lord of the Rings\\\\\" still rules the fantasy genre and has become an integral part of modern literature. It's an epic for all ages, and few books have even come close to equalling it.rd of the Rings\\\\\" still rules the fantasy genre and has become an integral part of modern literature. It's an epic for all ages, and few books have even come close to equalling it."

product_title: Road Trip to the Heart of Reality
review_body:
I do not recommend this book!! These concepts are pretty basic to most physicists, and he claims to illuminate them clearly?? Not with this writing style... the guy cannot write! The names used are ridiculous and the scenarios and situations so convoluted and poorly written that I found I fell asleep by the time sequoi IUEJRYUGSE or whoever was pulling his bow while running around a teepee, and kicking a rock and then doing a side roll down the hill... I read the other reviews and I wonder if these are by friends of his. This book is BAD. Just awful.
To add insult to injury, the pictures look like they were drawn by a 2 year old with a mouse and a bad painting program in microsoft.

I cannot emphasize enough how awful this book is...I want my money AND my time back

product_title: Woulda, Coulda, Shoulda: Overcoming Regrets, Mistakes, and Missed Opportunities
review_headline: Practical Advice--the rest is up to you!
review_body:
I admit it...I'm a perfectionist and an all-or-nothing sort of person. I'm also prone to global labeling and always want a guarantee of success without risk.
So, in dealing with the aftermath of a divorce, a relationship on the rocks, a stalled career, and financial collapse, it was incredible to find a book that gave practical advice (far better than the therapist I've seen) and the tools to change my life for the better. This book is well-written and has very little jargon. The authors don't sugarcoat or minimize the problems and are quite candid that people in need of their advice face a lifetime of continual work to keep from falling back into the woulda/coulda/shoulda traps. Since most of us W/S/C folks spend a lot of time thinking, changing your thoughts really does translate into a new life!
This book is a fast read...I was so hooked that I read it in two days, before and after work. Re-reading it is very useful and it doesn't hurt to take notes as you go along.
The pits of despair are still there but I'm not going to wallow in them any longer. This book was my lifeline out...maybe it will help you too.

product_title: The 5-Minute Veterinary Consult―Equine (The 5-Minute Veterinary Consult Series)
review_body: I was expecting the invaluable resource that the small animal version is, but I agree with other reviewers: it seems very disorganized. It also seems lacking in many pathological conditions that are, as they say, \\\\\not uncommon\\\\\"...I would rather use the Rose and Hodgson field guide any day..."

product_title: The Historian
review_body: I must say I was intrigued at first by the History, Dracula and the Characters.  But, after 250 pages, I was done.  The author just goes on and on. We never really do get a good story line on the Dracula character, not even at the bitter end.  If I still had my receipt, I would try and return this book for a full refund.

product_title: If Only It Were True
review_body:
I read this book a couple years back and then completely forgot about it until i saw commercials for the new movie with reese witherspoon. i thought it looked familiar.
like others review-writers, this book was an easy read. i think i finished it in an afternoon. The writing wasn't great, the story was alright, and the ending was not-so-surprising.
but overall, it was tolerable and at some points even interesting.
i'll say this in closing, the book was enjoyable enough that i'm looking forward to seeing the movie. but save your money, and borrow the book from a friend or a neighborhood library...it wasn't anything special.

product_title: The Blackest Heart
review_body: Vince Churchill writes so descriptively that it is possible to feel like the action is taking place right in front of you.  The story line wound around corner after corner and had me begging for what lay waiting and crouching ready to jump out at me.  Chapter 25 had me squriming in my chair, but in a GOOD way.  Lawman, sex, revenge, and gratuitous violence...nothing could be sweeter.  Can't wait to read the sequel.

product_title: Art Deco Interiors: Decoration and Design Classics of the 1920s and 1930s
review_body: Great book with many helpful photos. Great history of the art. Recommended to anyone who wants to know more about one of the 20th century's most important art forms.

product_title: Maui Trailblazer: Where to Hike, Snorkel, Paddle, Surf, Drive
review_body: The Maui Trailblazer got us organized and made it easy to roll right along and get a full appreciation of all the things that make Maui so extaordinary. With our crew it scored big, so big we bought a vacation timeshare.

product_title: Talking with Angels
review_headline: In praise of Talking with Angels
review_body:
This book is 1 of the better ones about angels. Situated in the dark times in Hungary of 1943/1944 is brings the message of the New World with is slowly happening now.
A very inspiring book that one reads slowly and over and over again, and always one finds something new.
A related book with described what happened in the concentrationcamp where the 2 Jewish women are deported is \\\\\Prisons on Wheels\\\\\"
Also is there a theatre-play about Gitta Mallasz the scribe of the book \\\\\"Talking with Angels\\\\\""

product_title: High School's Not Forever
review_body: I'm a big fan of Dr. Bluestein's work and this did not dissapoint me. This book is real...real kids, real problems, and blessedly real hope. I'm sorry it wasn't around when I was in high school, but I know it will help someone now. For too many kids, high school is a nightmare they live with their whole lives. This book lets them know they're not alone - a solution all by itself. But, as usual, Dr. Bluestein packs more goodies. If you're a fan, you'll already have this book. If you're not, you soon will be if you read it.

product_title: New Passages: Mapping Your Life Across Time
review_headline: Helps you understand yourself, your parents, your friends
review_body: The most interesting section of this book for me was right at the beginning where she describes the \\\\\endangered generation,\\\\\" those born from 1966-1980. While, I don't usually like to be called endangered, I could completely relate to the description of the troubles our generation is going through- how we have it worse off financially than our parents did in their twenties, and how that explains why we are floating in this in-between stage. This is happening just at the developmental stage in our lives when we'd feel a lot better if we had more financial freedom and didn't have to ask our parents for help. The stresses of dating, not being able to afford more than a cheap apartment (or worse- having to move back in with our parents), and being educated but in a competitive job market, take their toll. At this age, our parents were already married, owned their own home, and had a stable job. So things have changed a lot, and it helps to know that! It frees you to accept society as it is today and make the most of it. She ends the section with a positive prediction that our generation, expecting the least out of life after our disappointing start at adulthood, will end up very successful and appreciating what we have more than other generations. Sheehy is very insightful."

product_title: The Dark Half
review_body: This is the first time I've read a novel by King, and I must say I was impressed. I normally don't go in for Novels where the authors name is printed larger than the title; it reeks of commercialism, of trying to sell a book based on the authors name alone. But damn if King isn't one hell of good writer.I'm one of those \\\\\literate\\\\\" types who is loathe to succumb to anything as popular as Stephen King. In doing so I think I've forgotten how fun it can be to read a book for pleasure. Sure, there are themes in the book like the duality of man, an artists relationship to his art, etc., probably semi-autobiographical at some points too, but as I read this book I actually found myself having a great deal of fun. It's damned creepy too."

product_title: Men in Black: How the Supreme Court Is Destroying America
review_body:
It disappoints me that I can not be more enthusiastic about \\\\\Men In Black.\\\\\" Though I consider myself a conservative, I find that Mark Levin goes beyond conservativism into partisanship.

This is regrettable because Levin does succeed in explaining, particularly to lay audience, the history of the Supreme Court and its rightful place in American government, which are subjects that most people don't understand. The mechanics of the court system are not, for most people, comprehensible, much less exciting. Here, Levin provides solid scholarship accessible to the average person.

Levin does well in explaining and demonstrating how the Supreme Court - and all levels of our courts - have strayed from the intent of the Founders and established themselves as an unelected government superior in their own minds to the legislative and executive branches of government.

There can be no doubt of the accuracy of Levin's argument. The problem of \\\\\"Men In Blsck\\\\\" lies in Levin's adoption of certain cases and movements as evidence. For example, Levin chastises the Court for holding that burning the American flag is protected under the First Amendment. Well, I consider myself a conservative - and I agree with the Court. There are simply some issues that resonable people can disagree on, but Levin doesn't seem to allow that latitude. This is regrettable, because generally Levin's arguments are strong. Likewise, Levin allows himself to get wrapped up in Roe v. Wade and the entire abortion issue. There are many people, like myself, who believe that the legal reasoning in Row v. Wade is lacking, if not entirely non-existent. Yet it is possible at the same time for even conservatives to believe the ultimate holding is correct. In fact, I know that I am not alone in believing that abortion does constitute the taking of a human life, but that government has absolutely no right to dictate what a woman may do with regard to her own body. In other words, Roe v. Wade is simply not a good way to illustrate the truth of Levin's theme that \\\\\"the Supreme Court is destroying America.\\\\\" It is: but Roe v. Wade is not likely to get the majority of people to agree with that premise.

As I said, I wish I could offer \\\\\"Men In Black\\\\\" higher praise, but I think Levin picked the wrong way to illustrate by choosing polarizing examples. There are numerous other Supreme Court decisions he could have used that would have brought home the point that courts in general need to be reined in and brought under the control of the people, as the Founders intended.

Jerryds, Roe v. Wade is simply not a good way to illustrate the truth of Levin's theme that \\\\\"the Supreme Court is destroying America.\\\\\" It is: but Roe v. Wade is not likely to get the majority of people to agree with that premise.

As I said, I wish I could offer \\\\\"Men In Black\\\\\" higher praise, but I think Levin picked the wrong way to illustrate by choosing polarizing examples. There are numerous other Supreme Court decisions he could have used that would have brought home the point that courts in general need to be reined in and brought under the control of the people, as the Founders intended.

Jerry"

product_title: Only A Dog: The True Story of a Dog's Devotion to His Master in World War One
review_body: If you love dogs, this will make you cry. It is a lovely story but so very sad. And it is true. Everyone I know who has read this book thinks it is a classic and they admit also to shedding a tear or two....

product_title: Blind Your Ponies
review_body: Even though this book was set in a more contemporary time, it took me back to the 1970s when my two younger brothers played basketball in one of the small Montana towns mentioned as a rival team in the book.  I kept seeing things in that time frame.  There was  even a very near match for one of my brother's name including the real last name as one of the characters from the exact same team my brothers played on.  This book captures so faithfully the enthusiasm for high school basketball which seeps into every aspect of the small communities in SW Montana.  The characters were believable and very real to me at least.  I enjoyed this book very much and want to thank Mr. West for the nostalgic trip down memory lane.

product_title: Jewish Life in Muslim Libya: Rivals and Relatives
review_body: This is an insightful, rate work of scholarship on Libyan Jewry. It provides the historical background , and is excellent in detailing the special customs of this particular community.

product_title: The Seeing: A Novel
review_body: I'm naturally drawn to thrillers and have read many, this is one I found myself getting chills from.  The descriptions are vivid without being graphic, leaving just enough to the reader's imagination for a haunting visual.  The storyline is intriguing and I never felt like I needed to skim in order for it to move more quickly or that there were any gaps that the author did not cover.  Definitely pick up this book, although you may want to read it during daylight hours....

product_title: Southern Runnin' (Checkered Flag, Vol. 1)
review_body:
Pruitt has a good grasp of dialogue and scenery but his talent for putting together a plot is one of the best in all of crime writing.
Aside from a few diehard racing fans, most people wouldn't consider car racing a sport let alone one that requires talent.
Pruitt takes readers inside world where car racing is as admired as baseball, football, or hockey.
I spent my whole life dreaming of becoming a writer so I can easily relate to the Kincaid's obsession.
Pruitt's characters value family and country but the general public doesn't hold these values like they used to.
If United States soldiers didn't shed blood for our freedom, I wouldn't have the opportunity to share with you this outstanding work of crime fiction.

product_title: Time to Mourn, a Time to Comfort: A Guide to Jewish Bereavement and Comfort (Art of Jewish Living)
review_body: Ron Wolfson's A Time to Mourn, a Time to Comfort constitutes a sensitive and perceptive guide to the Jewish traditions that guide the mourner and those who seek to provide comfort. The tone is honest, tender, and wise. Jewish tradition offers mourners a structure for dealing with the turmoil of emotions and a guide through the days, weeks and months of recovery from a loss. It also guides the community around the mourner with sound and specific advice on how best to reach out to comfort those in pain. Wolfson details these traditions with a gentle and direct how-to approach, explaining both the traditions and the benefits and good sense of those practices.

product_title: The Savage Wars Of Peace: Small Wars And The Rise Of American Power
review_body:
The book describes all American small military interventions abroad starting from the beginning of the 19th century with the picturesque adventures of very few men fighting near the shores of Tripoli and ending with the war in Kosovo.

I am not a scholar, I am not American and I wasn't aware of some of the facts reported in this book. In my opinion the factual research is interesting and accurate.

I am not giving 5 stars because I think that the thesis sustained by the author against the Powell Doctrine and the conclusion \\\\\In deploying American power, decision makers should be less apologetic, less hesitant, less humble...\\\\\" are not fully supported by the facts searched by Mr. Boot."

product_title: My Reminiscences as a Cowboy (Paper Books)
review_headline: Life Imitates Art.....a Little Too Much !
review_body:
I started reading Frank Harris' memoirs with a great deal of interest. He'd come to Chicago as a fresh-faced, enthusiastic Irish kid, \\\\\straight off the boat\\\\\", but through hard work and personal service had commended himself to some Westerners with whom he soon became partners. Pretty good for a hotel bellhop ! But still, maybe it could have been true. Then, he rode off for eighteen months' adventures in Texas and New Mexico, purchasing, raiding, and driving cattle, sprinkled with gunfights with the Indians, duels and horseraces with Mexican grandees, and the hijinks of bored cowboys. Miraculous escapes and great physical feats abound. As I read, I began to feel that some o' these here scenes was a mite familiar. Sure enough, I decided, I'd definitely spotted them in Hollywood movies. Frank Harris' life resembled a movie, sure as shootin'. At last I reached the point where after escaping a possible Indian attack, as he and his companions drove a huge herd north through Texas, he intoned that just a few years later, General Custer and his men were wiped out by the same Indians close to that very spot. Well, sir, I may be a sucker, but I ain't that big of a one ! As I recall from my school days, the Little Big Horn was way up in Montana, or it used to be. Shoot, I guess you never can tell. But still, I got plumb suspicious. I looked on the internet. Seems Frank Harris had raised a few doubts in others' minds too. Maybe because at the time when he said he was fightin' Indians and ridin', ropin' and shootin', he was only around five years old ! Course I could be underestimatin' him.

If you don't take this as a gen-u-wine autobiography, but just as a cowboy tale, it can be enjoyable. The old fashioned attitudes to Indians and Mexicans might make you feel more than a little weary, but that was show biz, back in 1930, when he wrote. And, you might recognize a few scenes because after all, Frank Harris' life was turned into one or two films. Or was it that cowboy films turned into his life ? I give up.ms. Or was it that cowboy films turned into his life ? I give up."

product_title: Bottlefeeding Without Guilt: A Reassuring Guide for Loving Parents
review_body: I think the book was wonderful, and I truly believe we need more like them in the world. Not everyone is from the same situation, don't be so quick to judge another person's choice. I really wish these die hard people would focus on raising their own children then worrying about how I am feeding my child.

product_title: A Pirate of Exquisite Mind: Explorer, Naturalist, and Buccaneer: The Life of William Dampier
review_body:
A remarkable man died sometime in 1715 in London and was buried in an unmarked grave.

This would be of little note were it not for the fact he was one of the greatest explorers of all time, a pioneering navigator, a naturalist, hydrographer, travel writer and - probably to his disadvantage - a pirate. His maps were used by James Cook and Horatio Nelson, among others; his work as a naturalist influenced von Humboldt and Darwin, and his writings stirred the imagination of Defoe, Coleridge and Swift. He circumnavigated the world three times and was the first Englishman to explore Australia.
