product_title: Intova CP-9 Compact Digital Camera with 130 feet Waterproof Underwater Housing , 4GB Memory Card , Batteries , Charger and Accessory Kit
review_body: I was not sure what the quality would be like with the price being so low and all the extra freebies they offered. So, as soon as I got it I put the batteries in, the SD card and took some pictures. Much to my surprise they came out very nicely. When I get back from Mexico i'll do a follow up review and show some pics as well.

product_title: Canon PowerShot SX20IS 12.1MP Digital Camera with 20x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-Inch Articulating LCD (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body:
don't buy this camera canon power shot sx30is!!

as a big fan of canon and especially cannon customer service this canon power shot sx30is camera is very slow. you will miss many good pictures if you buy this camera. . when speaking with canon tech support they said this is normal even after we reset the camera to mode P and then continuous shooting af to what they felt would make it faster. it had the same problem in this mode as we had in normal auto mode before.....its still very slow...
......canon support was no help with this problem and could care less even when i asked could i get some kind of credit so i could buy one without this problem especially since it was only 6 months old and i used it 5x...flat out NO

i don't normally write reviews but this camera is terrible so if its between canon or panasonic buy panasonic as you get a lot more for your money and are very fast...sorry canon a very unhappy customer

product_title: B+W Clear UV Haze with Single Coating (010)
review_body: If you are going to buy a UV filter its probably to protect your lens. You will want something that is made well and will not cost almost as much as the lens itself. This lens is the perfect balance between price and quality. I use B+W filters for all my Canon L lenses. They are built extremely well, they don't smudge when dirty like some other brands do, and they do not degrade image quality. B+W is definitely one of the best brands out there.

product_title: Pelican 0910-015-110 Memory Card Case - Polycarbonate - Black - 16 Memory Card
review_body: Living up to the Pelican brand, this case is a must-have for those carrying around more than a couple of memory cards. The foam easily accepts memory cards, and keeps this neatly at hand (or back pocket) during shoots. Where I used to have lots of little clam shell clad cards, the Pelican ate 'em up and made the single servings obsolete. While it wasn't the first purchase after my camera, it should have been. At a minimum, add to your wish list, otherwise make the 1-Click Purchase and wrap it around your cards ASAP!

product_title: Maximal Power DB FUJ NP50
review_headline: A Poor Replacement for the Fuji NP-50
review_body: I've been using this battery in my Fuji X10 for over a month now, and I can report that the battery powers the camera up just fine, and is good for 50 to 100 shots, depending upon exposure mode, etc.  I wasn't expecting this battery to perform as well as the OEM unit, but this performance is unacceptable.  Worse yet, the battery goes from showing a full charge, to completely dead, without warning.  I would have given this only one star, but admittedly, the price:performance ratio is acceptable.

product_title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS2 Digital Camera Battery Charger (110/220v with Car & EU adapters) - Replacement Charger for Panasonic BCF10E, BCG10, & BCJ13 Batteries -
review_body: The charger works great and unlike some other brands of aftermarket chargers, the battery fits snugly in the charger without shimming with cardboard, tape, etc.  Quality seems good and the car cord is a big plus.

product_title: Orion SkyScanner 100mm TableTop Reflector Telescope
review_body: I bought this to learn my way around the sky and hopefully see some things better than I could with a naked eye.  I was really pleased with what I got for the price! $100 gets you all set up to begin your journey into the cosmos.  There are definite shortcomings with this scope, firstly as mentioned before the finder scope is very hard to use for objects far above the horizon, also there is no way to collimate the scope without serious modifications that could easily destroy the scope.  Now on the positive side, it's extremely light which makes it ideal for quick viewings or take for travel.  I use this scope every single clear night I possibly can, just have it on the kitchen table take it out back when the skies are clear and voila.  I think that most people's opinions of this scope will be based on their expectations, don't think you will get hubble scope views.    What you will see.  Moon:  Great views, nice clear detail on the craters.  The scope is small enough you don't need a moon filter to keep from going blind, unless you're going to do some extended lunar viewing.  Jupiter:  You can definitely see some of the cloud bands and if the skies are not too turbulent the detail will be all the better, the Galilean moons are also really easy to see (Hint: for better views of Jupiter get the moons in focus.)  Saturn:  I haven't had this scope during a good period of viewing yet, but what I was able to see were the rings and the moon Titan, the color was not very distinguishable though.  Mars:  I'm waiting for March to see what it can do.  So far it's just been a reddish/brown dot.  Pleiades:  Very nice cluster to check out, you can see quite a few stars in it.  Orion Nebula (M42):  This will look like a small star luminated smudge, pretty cool though.  I live in an extremely light polluted area, and this scope still does well.  If you're going to get any accessories I would recommend the Shorty Barlow.

product_title: Nikon COOLPIX S9100 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 18x NIKKOR ED Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and Full HD 1080p Video
review_body: I am a snapshot dad.  I don't know ISO from metering, how to balance my white or choose my AF area.  I know how to zoom in and out, point, push the shutter button half way down to let the camera focus and then pull the trigger.  I also know what a clear, real-to-life picture looks like.  I have 2 other cameras.  A Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ20 and a Nikon Coolpix S200.  I use the Panasonic whenever I know I'm going some place that the size of the camera will not be a hindrance.  It's the size and shape of a typical SLR camera.  It also takes incredible pictures - even in my hands.  Love it.  I use the S200 for everything else.  It's a nice albeit limited camera.  The zoom is only 3x and the flash leaves something to be desired.  I purchased the S9100 to replace the S200 and will keep the S200 around in the glove box for times I didn't bring one of the others and to use as a sort of \\\\\I don't care what happens to it\\\\\" camera like when skiing or sailing.  For testing purposes I put the S9100 head to head with the Panasonic.  I took pictures at various zoom lengths, in different lighting conditions both with and without flash and snapped some moving pictures of kids riding bikes, cars going down the street and people playing with their dogs in the nearby park.  I would snap a picture with the Panasonic and then with the S9100.  While the moving pictures were impossible to truly replicate I kept things as consistent as I could with zoom length, using or not using flash, etc..  Then, I took them back home, removed the SD cards and looked at the photos on my PC using Picasa.  The S9100 consistently took absolutely fabulous pictures.  It equaled the Panasonic in clarity and overall true-to-life representation.  Plus, it bested the Panasonic in low light situations and the extra zoom length (the Panasonic maxes out at 12x) allowed me to get in a little closer.  The S9100 has a personality.  You could almost call it an attitude.  Sometimes, it couldn't focus perfectly creating a blurry picture.  This was solved by either changing the zoom or stepping forwards or back a step.  It wasn't often and the Panasonic displayed some of the same behavior.  The S9100 seemed to perform flawlessly if what I was photographing was maybe 4 feet away or further.  Up closer, it would sometimes have focus difficulty.  What you see on the screen is absolutely what you get.  When you push the shutter button half way down to let the camera focus it will show you exactly what your picture will look like.  Believe the screen.  I have large, heavy hands that just don't get along with today's little things.  The S200 was often a struggle for me.  The S9100 feels comfortable (although I wouldn't complain if it were heavier) and the controls react nicely to my less than deft meat hooks.  I had no problems with the zoom ring after a few minutes with the camera and the button you slide down to engage the flash was immediately intuitive and easy to operate.  Looking at and deleting pictures was also thumb friendly.  No fussing or cursing with this one.  I call this one a keeper.  The picture quality, even when super-zooming in on the photo in Picasa are crystal clear, the zoom works well without sacrificing picture quality, the flash is basically incredible and I found the entire camera to be easy to use.  All that is left to find out is if it holds up over the long haul."

product_title: Malden Black 4-opening wood collage frame for 8x10 prints - 8x10
review_body: Cheaply made frame that was broken when I opened the box. Had to buy wood glue to put the thing back together.

product_title: Nikon COOLPIX 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 14x Optical Zoom NIKKOR ED Glass Lens and Full HD 1080p Video
review_body: Just received my Nikon S8200 today.  There are tons of features on this camera, some of which I may never use but it's nice to have them.  I read some reviews about the camera before purchasing it, the most frequent complaint of which related to the auto flash.  It is located right where your left index finger normally rests on the top left surface of the camera and the flash pops up into your finger.  It's kind of annoying and makes me wonder why Nikon designed it that way.  Additionally, you can't push the flash back down manually. You must shut the camera off completely which automatically retracts the flash.  Then you have to turn the camera back on.  Weird!!  The other thing that is lacking is a hard copy of the User Manual.  It comes with a very brief \\\\\Quick Start\\\\\" manual and a disk to download the big manual but no hard copy to carry with you.  The disk is printable but a book would be nice. Otherwise it's a beautiful piece, seems solid and well made and I'm looking forward to a lot of good use."

product_title: Olympus 7X21 PC III Classic Binocular (Blue)
review_body: The Olympus 7X21 PC III Classic Binoculars are awesome. I bought this pair to go see a Patriots - Cowboys football game, and we ended up in the nosebleed section (3rd level). And wow, They are perfect for sporting events. The price is right, and they are small and compact and very clear. My friend had a bigger more powerful (and more expensive) pair of binoculars and everyone wanted to use my Olympus. I recommend these to any one, very impressive.

product_title: Nikon D3100 14.2MP Digital SLR Camera
review_headline: Awesome Camera with just a few caveats
review_body: This is an amazing camera for the price, especially for someone getting their first DSLR. I got this camera, because I'm about to have a little girl and I wanted to take better pictures than I could with my Droid. Now that I have it, and have taken some pictures, I want to take more pictures of everything. I see amazing shots all around me everyday now.  It does have a little bit of a learning curve to it, if you've never used a DSLR (I think all DSLRs do though). There are only two complaints that I have. The first one is a lack of AEB (automatic exposure bracketing). I've seen some really amazing shots that are HDR (high dynamic range) images. The easiest way to do these kinds of shots is with AEB, but that option is reserved for the higher end Nikons. You can still achieve HDR shots without AEB, but you need to either use the timer to reduce shake, or a remote shutter. Which brings me to my second issue with this camera. The D3100, from my understanding, replaces the D3000. The D3000 has an infrared sensor on the front for using a wireless remote shutter. For some reason Nikon removed the sensor from the D3100. You can still purchase a corded remote, or a wireless remote that comes with a wired sensor, but it would have been nice if Nikon had made it easier to take HDR shots on this camera. If you are aware of these two things, and still purchase the camera, I think you will be happy.

product_title: Nikon COOLPIX L24 14 MP Digital Camera with 3.6x NIKKOR Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCD
review_body: I thought buying anything Nikon would be safe...I was wrong...The Coolpix L24 looks nice...but with it's extremely slow shutter speed,you or your subject better not breathe or it blurs...Extremely disappointed...Plan on returning it...

product_title: Carson 60X-100X MicroMax LED Lighted Pocket Microscope
review_headline: I WAS USE TO USING A REGULAR  LOUPE...
review_body:
I am conflicted with this review. I have always used a 'regular' jeweler's loupe but needed a higher power to identify identify biting bugs.

PRO: Let's just say I was shocked...it worked! I saw things I did not expect to see and not just bugs. Couldn't understand why we all have bites on us that won't heal, itched, felt fatigued and ached. Now I go to the Dr. with proof so hopefully our family can be treated immediately. I could see things in detail I couldn't see with a 20x loupe at all! This opened up a new world for me. The little dots we see as dust are not always dust! It has served it's purpose. I just hope that now that I have found out things with it I won't be addicted to checking every little piece of dust. It could drive a person crazy! This seems to be a quality product.

CON: Be prepared if you haven't used a microscope or don't remember from high school when you did use one! This is not a regular loupe it is a microscope. With a loupe you just look in it and see your item and that's it. No focusing to do. I had trouble adjusting the zoom and focus to get the results. First of all the things I was looking at were the size of dust or less. It took me lots of time to even find them with the loop ( I had them on transparent tape) and when I finally did, I had a heck of a time focusing it right. The microscope is small and I had trouble holding it, finding the things, focusing it and then I kept hitting the zoom and focus buttons accidentally with my fingers, would move the tape and have to find the thing all over again. You have to move it the opposite direction you really need to go to as everything is reversed. Had trouble getting use to that. I ended up with headaches from squinting and bending my neck down for so long. Ouch! The light is still working, but dim, so I have to buy more batteries, of course.

I believe this item works just as it is suppose to. I am just not use to using a microscope. For those who are use to it or a quicker study than me, you will love it. I am also going to order a regular loupe with higher power to see if I can see what I need to with that as it is so much faster and easier. I doubt it though.

product_title: LOREX LW2301 4-Channel Wireless Quad Surveillance System with Digital Video Recorder & 1 Indoor/Outdoor Motion Camera
review_body: The camera works as advertised, but what they don't advertise is the picture quality. Both coler and sharpness are unacceptable.

product_title: Camera Strap Buddy-SB1
review_body: At a little over $14 this is a can't miss item. If you are happy with your present camera strap, then the Strap Buddy will make your photography a little more comfortable at a fraction of the cost of other solutions. It takes that camera that is banging against your chest or stomach and puts it comfortably at your side.  If you have a good sized DSLR or SLR with a heavy lens, this item becomes aces in taking strain off the back of your neck. It is sturdy built. It removes from the tripod attachment location if needed without the use of any tools. My camera (Canon XTi) hangs comfortably and ready for quick access at my hip just below my waist. My lens points down at maybe a 45 degree angle.  The Strap Buddy and a good camera strap is a good thing.

product_title: LOFTEK Nexus 543 Outdoor Wireless/wired Waterproof Ip Camera 4mm Lens 36 Infrared Leds with Night Vision. Silver(UK adapter+US/EU Transverter)
review_headline: Decent but buggy and no motion detection recordings
review_body:
Pretty easy to install if you know about port forwarding, then it's a breeze.

In no time I was at work and able to open a browser to my router's public IP along with the :port I chose and I got my video feed. Also works well on mobile phones, but slower if you're on 3G only.

But no motion detection recordings. Although set to alarm with only action being record, it never posts recordings unless I actively make it (using the software).

And in a browser, it starts as 320x viewing...upon making it 640x it crashes the browser...every time.

product_title: Canon VIXIA HF S30 Flash Memory Camcorder with SuperRange Optical Image Stabilizer with Powered IS
review_headline: FRAGILE lens cover, TERRIBLE touch screen menus
review_body:
Bought the HF-M31 version of this camera.

Camera/tripod blew over in the wind and some sand got into the lens cover. Wouldn't open correctly. VERY FRAGILE! Took it to Canon repair (camera was 6 months old, still under warranty) and they want $249 to repair it!! If I'd known how fragile the shutter-style lens was, I'd either have put a UV filter over it or bought a different brand.

Touch screen is TERRIBLE. Some menus you swipe up to scroll, others you swipe down. Always selecting the wrong thing. Menus NOT intuitive.

Avoid the Vixia line!

product_title: DicaPac WP410 (10.5x16.0cm) Small Zoom Alfa Waterproof Digital Camera Case with Optical Lens (Clear)
review_body:
This camera case is a great value. I have multiple pocket sized digital cameras from Canon, and this case is great because it's compatible with all of them. I can also loan the case to my friends and family and it works with their cameras. It's way cheaper than buying the custom cases offered by Canon which can run $100+.

This case is pretty much a fancy ziplock bag, and probably costs them like $1 to make. However, I am very pleased with the case so far. I haven't had any problems with water leakage, and my pictures have all come out wonderfully clear. I even took some underwater video which came out really nice. Even though the case is significantly larger than my camera, it's still easy enough to position the camera, and I don't consider it a hassle to use at all. The case is also fold-able, lightweight, and compact which makes it ideal for travel.

I used to have a custom Canon camera case which I paid $150 for. That case worked great and I was happy with it, but it was useless once I upgraded cameras. This cheap case does the same thing for 20% of the price. Overall, for the price and durability, you can't beat this. Get one!

product_title: Fotasy Cine Movie Lens to Nikon 1 Mirrorless Cameras3
review_body: I am so pleased with this protector. It applies easily and fits perfectly. One would not have a clue the LCD and info window are covered and well protected.  The clarity of viewing can't be beat. I will buy this screen for my other camera and recommend it without reservation.

product_title: ePhoto Professional Video Camera Fluid Drag Tripod Head by ePhoto INC 717AH
review_headline: Portability, workability and price = Fancier FT 717AH
review_body: I was looking for something more portable and lightweight than the 15lb Vinten head and sticks that I've been lugging around with my JVC GY HM-100u (about a 4lb camera). When I stumbled across reviews on this Fancier FT-717AH fluid head for $70 that many are using for their DSLRs, I was intrigued. I like to travel and don't want to check multiple bags. Because this ow cost head got such nice reviews got such nice reviews, I thought I'd give it a try with my little set of under $80 aluminum tripod (Giotto's MTL 9240B). I was pleasantly surprised at how smooth and solid the head is. It's very capable of handling the weight of more than a DSLR set up. It's a bit stiff in the panning as many bloggers will tell you, but some like prefer it that way. You can open and clean out the existing panning grease and replace it with a silicon grease for looser panning in about 20 minutes. Having done that, it's a perfect little head for a one-man-shooting band. Deserves 5 stars because it's only $70 and works great and it ties right on to my backpack.

product_title: LP-E8 LPE8 Li-Ion Equivalent Battery for Canon EOS Rebel 550D T2i Kiss X4
review_body: I bought this as a backup to my native Canon T2i battery. It holds just as much charge and is just as reliable as the Canon product. Its only drawback is its inability to tell the T2i how much charge it has left (the official Canon batteries have a chip inside them that do this). So, I recommend this battery as a backup in case your Canon battery dies, or if you don't care how much charge is left in it.

product_title: Janco Canon Compatible EP-EX15II Eyepiece Extender for the Canon Digital Rebel T1i, Xsi Digital Cameras
review_body: I put this on my camera and it fell off when I took camera out of my bag. It kept doing this and now I it is lost. It fell off and I didn't notice where it went. I was out in the woods and couldn't find it back.

product_title: Hello Kitty Digital Camera
review_headline: Wasn't what I thought it was....
review_body: My niece loved this for Christmas, although it wasn't quite what I expected. I thought it was going to be like a real digital camera where you could view the pictures in the back, like most do. To view the pictures you must load the software *which is difficult if you have windows 7 or vista* and plug the camera into a usb port. Although she loves it, it wasn't what I thought it was.

product_title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ40 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 24x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD - Black (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_body: I loved my new LUMIX DMC FZ40 until I tried to download movies to my PC.  I run Dreamweaver and Photoshop CS3 and have plenty of horsepower left over, but the movies, even though showing on the camera LCD screen will not download to the computer.  Going on line to solve the problem only illustrated how widespread this problem is, with no viable solutions suggested.  I feel ripped-off.  Had I known about this problem beforehand I would never have purchased the camera.  My DMC FZ50 (stolen) had no problem with movies so I just presumed . . .

product_title: Sony LCS-HE Soft Carrying Case for DSC-HX1
review_body: I purchased this case for my Sony HX1 camera. This is probably the best possible case for this camera if you don't want to carry other object in the case. It is sleek, light and definitely provides some protection to camera.    It is easy to carry on shoulders and fit in a backpack.    This case will fit only the camera and nothing else. It a matter of personal taste whether you need to carry other things. I am not using any accessory with camera so don't need extra space.    Amazon rocks in whatever thet sell! Fast delivery and genuine product..

product_title: Hoya 62mm 3-Piece Digital Filter Set (HMC UV Ultraviolet, Circular Polarizer & ND8 Neutral Density) with Case + Cleaning Kit for Canon, Nikon, Sony, Olympus & Pentax Lenses
review_headline: Decent filters, questionable packing from Hoya itself
review_body: Filters appear to work well and are of decent quality for the money. Better than super cheap ones, but not quite as nice as expensive ones like B&W. However, the sealed package I received had similar issues regarding smudges on the polarized lens. I would have thought it was just my kit had I not noticed how many people were getting this lens from the vendor in a sealed package with sticky residue on the brand new lens. I would buy these again, but that smudge was annoying for a brand new item and took careful, tedious cleaning to get it off.  3 stars for that reason.

product_title: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD
review_body: This camera is everything it says and it's smaller then I expected, which is even better. Canon has outdone themselves with this one.

product_title: Canon Powershot S2 IS 5MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (OLD MODEL)
review_body: I just thought I'd speak up for this camera in case there are those who are tempted to purchase a used version. For $300+ brand new here on Amazon in 2005, this camera has delivered. No black screen of death (yet) and this camera has been around the block a few times, including getting beach/boat time in Mexico some years back. What drew me to the camera was: AA batteries, viewfinder, zoom (good for its time; admittedly, I'm tempted by the newer cameras), video with very decent sound, the swiveling LCD screen (comes in extremely handy). Whenever I take it on vacation, I still carry the book with me. So much electronics and so many icons icons, I can better operate an old fashioned film camera. One thing I absolutely swear by are the Energizer e-series lithium batteries. They last forever.

product_title: Nikon D90 12.3MP DX-Format CMOS Digital SLR Camera
review_body: I am a photo enthusiast and have previously been shooting with a Nikon D50. I enter this review with mixed feelings. I received my Nikon D90 around Jan 4th this year and was instantly amazed with its ability. Because of my previous experience with the D50, it did not take long to get accustom with the D90 and was quite surprised at the ease of familiarizing myself with the new camera. I did try to read up as much as possible because I feel that is the most importand thing to do in photography, knowing your camera inside and out. For the first two weeks, I would say it performed beautifully,as expected. However shortly there after I began noticing pictures that were grossly underexposed speradically through a shoot. I shoot sporting events indoor with various lighting. Here are my usual settings. ISO-1600 to 2000 with High ISO NR on,WB-K at various settings depending on lighting, burst and single exposure modes, AF area mode-Dynamic area,Center focus point-wide,Meter-Center weighted. I shoot approximately 200-400 photos over a period of about 3 hours with several breaks throughout the session. Photos in question are almost completely backed out but look as though they are very underexposed with just hints of the subject on the outer edges. These photos will be scattered about the shoot so it has been very difficult to pinpoint exactly what might be going on to cause this but I have been very surprised with that this is happening. The last session, I had about 25-30 of these misshots in a little over 400 photos. The Customer Service Dept. has been very gracious and helpful to try to resolve this problem and after talking to Nikon USA and Amazon Support, I have a new camera being shipped as a replacement. I am very pleased with this as I feel like it is a defect with the camera and did not feel like this problem should be showing up this soon. The D50 never has had any problem like this but it does not have the setting capability that the D90 has, so I will not try tocompare their performances. I hope the problem is with this particular camera and not the model. I am a Nikon fan and will continue to be but this is a discouraging chapter in my history with Nikon products. I will certainly update my review and star rating after I have had a chance to use the new camera.

product_title: Nikon D90 12.3MP DX-Format CMOS Digital SLR Camera
review_body: Have used the d90 wi the Opteka battery grip for approximately two weeks. Am still learning. Have taken over 40gb's of digital images in nef & jpeg and have been extremely pleased overall wi the images (once adjusted for conditions). Shot still and action at 4.5 frames/sec. Great value for the price.

product_title: 206 Media System Bag (Black w/ Black Trim)
review_headline: Top Quality Photo Bag for Pros and Amateurs-Perfect for Leicas
review_body:
For background, I am an amateur photographer using a Leica rangefinder with a few lenses and have used a Billingham for a few years.

Billingham is a traditional English bag maker. They were old-school before there was old-school. Their bags are aimed at the pro and amateur wanting some of the pro tools. When I say pro, I am referring to the beat photojournalists working on a deadline or the world traveling journalist on harsh urban safaris throughout the world.

Bag is built with heavy canvas and luxuriant leather trim, like you would find in a fine English car. The interior is thickly padded in a dark contrasting green. And like most things of this quality the buckles and belts and gussets and straps and zippers are all heavy duty and get more comfortable with use.

The pluses are:

1. It is like carrying the LandRover of bags (for those in the know).
2. It feels like it would stop a speeding bullet to protect your gear
3. The \\\\\reporter\\\\\" top is a gape mouth that opens and closes easily to give you quick access to your gear with a generous flap to keep out the elements
4. There are lots of pockets to stow (and forget where you put) the odd photo bits
5. Holds a body-lens and 1 or 2 additional lenses comfortably (about all you really need on the move)

The minuses are:
1. Like a LandRover it is heavy.
2. It is old-school in that it does not have lots of netted see thru space or small storage places for modern photo equipment (SD Cards, batteries, etc). Everything defaults to oversized pockets for you to fish around in.

If you like the status of a great bag or a throwback to traditional style this is your bag. If you want the latest bells and whistles or light weight this may not be it.

One final note: this is a purpose built bag, so would only recommend for photography.

If in doubt go with the black - it looks good in all situations. The khaki is a little too safari... unless you are going on safari."

product_title: 4GB Micro SD Memory Card FOR BlackBerry Curve 8330 4 GB
review_body: Very satisfied, and pleasantly pleased with this product. Couldn't ask for a better price. It works for all of my BlackBerry media needs!

product_title: Olympus Stylus 6000 10MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-inch LCD
review_body: Great camera, easy to use with lots of nice features.  Completely waterproof (so far) and takes great pics underwater.  Have not dropped it to test the anti-shock feature but Consumer Reports says it will indeed survive a 5 foot fall on cement.  I had the pentax W30 camera before this one and the picture quality from this olympus is far better.  I'd recommend this camera to anyone who needs a good quality durable point and shoot digital. Why would you NOT buy a waterproof camera?

product_title: Lowepro Slingshot 200 All Weather Backpack
review_headline: Slingshot 200 Worked  Well on Alaskan Cruise!
review_body: My Lowepro Slingshot 200 all weather backpack worked very well.  I could swing it around and get the gear I needed.  I have had headaches from the camera strap around my neck on hikes so I wanted to try a backpack.  At age 54 it  worked much better. I still had some aches with a long hike, but no headaches.  If you carry more gear, this can carry camera, extra lens, flash, small handycam recorder, and all the extra items for using them. I lightened the pack of extras when I knew I would not use all the gear and that helped with the weight.

product_title: Bower SFD926N Nikon i-TTL Power Zoom Flash
review_headline: Good, but needs more Information to compair other Products/Flash Unites!
review_body:
I had a hard time trying to find out the necessary or proper information-Specifications to this Bower SFD926N and other \\\\\Bower Flash Units\\\\\" (Bower SFD35N). It is much harder to determine if the Flash unite I needed and/or wanted is the right or correct one to be used without the proper information being listed, right Folks!

It seemed to have most or all the features I needed for my two Nikon cameras, a D-80 and a D-300. Even the \\\\\"Bower Web site\\\\\" does not have that much information. [...]"

product_title: Canon PSC-1050 Deluxe Leather Case (Red)
review_body: The Canon SD780IS is a small camera & this case fits perfectly.  The case is a more metallic lite red than the picture shows.  It has the added bonus of a belt loop on the back.  I put the wrist strap for the camera to the side rather than thru the hole at the top of the case, and you can easily pull the camera out.

product_title: Smartparts SP800W 8-Inch Digital Picture Wood Frame
review_headline: A gift that keeps on giving
review_body: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my mom, and I couldn't be happier. She loves it! The frame was exceptionally easy to set up, and the photos are sharp and clear. I would buy this for myself, and I just might.

product_title: Olympus Stylus 850SW 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Old Model)
review_body: I have used Canon small cameras (ELPHS and SureShots) extensively for at least 15 years, for thousands of vacation and family photos under all sorts of conditions.  Because I am always dropping cameras and cell phones, I decided to try the \\\\\unbreakable\\\\\" Olympus 850SW.  Well, I might not drop it; I might THROW it at something after trying to use it for two months.  (1)  The battery life is nonexistent.  I hardly ever had to charge any of my Canons; they would run for two days of constant shooting on vacation, for example.  This Olympus battery dies in a half-hour. (2) The storage card is, as many have pointed out, uncommon.  It turns out to really annoy me to have to carry an extra cable, etc.  (3)  Despite its 20+ special settings, I couldn't get a single decent picture at an indoor fashion show, not with any setting, not in regular auto mode--nothing.  Again, in comparison to the long list of Canons I've had, this is pathetic.  I never had to worry about focus with a Canon.  This camera looks cool and may be indestructible; it's just not a good CAMERA."

product_title: Flip Video Tripod
review_body: I bought the mini flip-video camera to make Youtube movies. I love the camera. The tripod was very tiny, smaller than I expected. The tripod can be used to point the little camcorder at its target, but the camera is so small and easy to use, I found that I really do not need the tripod. The camera can be set on anything and get the same results. It's nice to have the tripod, just in case, but for me, it is basically useless.

product_title: Instant Film, Type 669, Medium Contrast, Color, Sold as 1 pack
review_body: All four packs of Polaroid were bad. The tabs were not connected or were crumpled where they would not pull out. I been using the 669 film for fourteen years & teaching Polaroid Transfer. It is no wonder that Polaroid quit making the film. They have a big problem with manufacting it. I lost $66.00. Would not buy anymore of the film from Amazon.

product_title: Nikon Coolpix P6000 13.5MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
review_headline: No SLR replacement, but a good take-everywhere camera
review_body:
I just got this camera yesterday evening and have had time to play with just about all the main features. I also own a Canon PowerShot G9 so I find myself comparing the two all the time. With that said, I wasn't expecting anything with ultra low noise. The G9 noise levels are unacceptable (in my opinion) at any ISO setting over 200. Having come from this same type of CCD, I wasn't expecting miracles so I'm not disappointed. If anything, I think the noise is on par or a little less noticeable on the P6000 than it is on the G9. That was a surprise considering that the P6000 is packing in more pixels on the same sized CCD. Here's my summary:

Noise = not great, but not bad at all as long as you stay ISO 200 or lower. If you go up to 400 and above, plan on using noise reduction software.

Optics = not tack sharp like you can get out of a dSLR, but, again, not bad. It reminds me of a good mid-range P&S camera in terms of optics. I think the G9 might be a little better here.

GPS = great! I really love this. Two words of warning: it eats the battery quickly and it takes a while to lock on to the GPS signal (especially if you are in a city like Chicago). Once it's locked on, the GPS coordinates are pretty accurate.

Speed = Good. I found the camera responsive. No speed demon, but shutter lag isn't a problem and all the camera functions are fairly snappy.

Mac Compatible = 50/50. It's terrible if you're expecting native Mac support from Nikon on it's new RAW format. It's great if you're just shooting JPG images. I only use a Mac, but third-party solutions are already available to let you process the RAW files on your Mac. Lightroom 2.1 is compatible with the new format and so is Adobe's Camera RAW 4.6 plugin for Photoshop and Photoshop Elements. I've been shooting almost exclusively with RAW and happily processing them on my Mac with no problems at all.

Size = GREAT! I love the size. It's just about the same physical size as the G9, but it's twice as light. It's much easier to take this camera long and stuff it into a loose pocket. You almost don't know it's there. Anything smaller would have been too small.

Vibration Reduction = a must have. It really works well, especially in lower light settings.

You'll enjoy this camera if you want a high-quality compact camera that has GPS, RAW and great creative control. It is a nice camera to take along with you when you just don't feel like pulling out the dSLR, but don't expect it to be a dSLR replacement because it's not. I'm quite happy with it and look forward to using it more and more.s much easier to take this camera long and stuff it into a loose pocket. You almost don't know it's there. Anything smaller would have been too small. Vibration Reduction = a must have. It really works well, especially in lower light settings. You'll enjoy this camera if you want a high-quality compact camera that has GPS, RAW and great creative control. It is a nice camera to take along with you when you just don't feel like pulling out the dSLR, but don't expect it to be a dSLR replacement because it's not. I'm quite happy with it and look forward to using it more and more.

product_title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-LZ10 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom
review_body: This camera exceeded my expectations.  It delivers wonderful pictures.  The settings are easily mastered and simple to use.  My wife and I love  the shots we took over the last two weeks.  Scenery and architecture  shots are great

product_title: Tamrac Adventure 74 Digital Photo Backpack (Black)
review_body: I use a modular Think-Tank belt system (fully loaded) and I needed additional storage for my camera gear and the Tamrac Adventure fit the bill just fine and at a very reasonable price.

product_title: Canon Digital Rebel XT 8MP Digital SLR Camera
review_body: This is my first dSLR camera. While most stores display the XTi and eventually the XSi, the XT is adequate for my needs. I believe I do not need the potentially ineffective sensor cleaning feature, live view, eye proximity detector, extra focal points, or the extra resolution. I ordered the XT with the EF-S 18-55mm 3.5-5.6 IS lens for only around $180. After buying the 4 GB Sandisk CF card I spent less than $700 total. A few years ago, I would only be a able to buy a high-end point and shoot camera. In the near future, I plan to buy the EF 50mm 1.8 II prime lens as well.     Pros:  -Inexpensive  -Compact; great for traveling, even fits in my backpack with my 18-55mm IS attached.  -Very good ISO performance from 100-800. 1600 is OK  -Handy back-lit monochrome LCD display  -Built-in flash for starting out in dSLR photography and hot-shoe for future external flash  -Very fast response  -Shutter, aperture, and focus point display in viewfinder.  -Custom functions allow some tweaking.     Cons:  -Changing white balance, ISO, AF mode, and light metering requires use of the color LCD screen that is hard to see in sunlight. I wish the shortcut buttons just toggle through the settings and that I could see the resulting changes on the monochrome LCD.  -No spot metering  -Thumb wheel is too firm to easily rotate  -CF pins may be easy to bend resulting in expensive repairs

product_title: Kodak Performance Series Digital Camera Case for,  DX6490, 7000 & 700 seriesCameras
review_body: I love the carrying case. It really protects my camera. I don't have to worry about damaging the camera by putting it in my purse. The small compartments inside for both the memory card and extra batteries makes life easier for any photographer. I plan on buying another one for my boyfriend who has the same camera that I have.

product_title: Canon RC-1 Wireless Remote Control for Select DSLR Cameras
review_body: Haven't used it much, but it's a great addition to my Canon Rebel XTi!  I love that it's designed to be stored on the neck strap with the buttons toward the piece that's connected to the strap.  This way, there isn't any accidental pressing of the shutter release causing your battery to become drained.  I's also nice that it has both a 2second and 0second delay, so it can be used for either situation.

product_title: Philips 6.5-Inch Digital Picture Frame (White)
review_body: It was a Christmas gift for my wife and she loved it! It is every thing it was advertised to be.

product_title: HP Photosmart R937 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom
review_body: I was looking for a quality camera that did not require a lot of expertise and was very easy to use.  This camera is just that, the touch screen menu makes use a snap and the pictures and videos are excellent.  I would recommend it to anyone that doesn't know a lot about cameras, but wants to take great photos.

product_title: Pentax Optio W30 7.1 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom
review_body: i consider myself a reasonably good prosumer digital photographer. bought a pentax w30 off ebay. paid with paypal. took it underwater in thigh deep water--camera was submerged at about 6-8 inches or so. the camera filled up with water and stopped working after a couple of clicks.    like several other consumers, very disappointed. contacted seller who told me contact pentax. have done so with no response from pentax. have also have disputed payment with paypal and intend to pursue this in a small claims court if necessary. but really, what a disappointment!    others with a similar experience, please contact me directly and may be we can pursue pentax to do something about it together. i am at sarosh_khan at ksg08 dot harvard dot edu.    to all those who are interested in a waterproof camera, go with the olympus stylus 770 sw [[ASIN:B000OY1LT6 Olympus Stylus 770 SW 7.1 Megapixel Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom + Olympus M-2GB High Capacity xD-Picture Card + Olympus xD-Picture Card Reader/Writer + Spare Li-40B Battery + Digital Camera Case]]. i got mine from ritz camera with their extended service plan which covers water damage as well. free shipping and no sales tax makes the price competitive.     unlike the pentax, so far its working out very well. again, what a disappointment the pentax turned out to be!

product_title: Sony VCT870RM Tripod w/Remote for Sony MiniDV, DVD, HDR-HC5 & HC7 Camcorders
review_headline: Disappointed - could be a lot better
review_body: RE: SONY 870RM TRIPOD    The fluid head is really fine for pans and tilts - exceptionally smooth for the relatively low cost.    HOWEVER - the design and build of the neck (yoke) and leg assembly is weak.  The unit I received actually \\\\\twists\\\\\" as I pan the camera.  Even with the leg spreader wide open, the yoke assembly that supports the legs at the top is just not adequate for the resistance offered by the pan head.  I could try reinforcing the yoke by adding screws through it into each leg but I'm sure that would void the warranty.    My $60. Velbon brand tripod is more sturdy in this regard however its pan head is not as good as the Sony and it it does not have the remote control.    The remote control on the handle requires a \\\\\"LANC\\\\\" connection receptacle on the camcorder.  It will start and stop the tape in the camera.     The problem is with the zoom control.  Although it allows you to smoothly vary the speed of the zoom, the design is backwards!  The zoom requires the camera operator to push backward to zoom IN and forward to zoom OUT - the exact opposite of the zoom rocker switch on the camera!!! Totally illogical. I could get used to it but it's just another unnecessary quirk to put up with.    I will probably be returning this unit or at least exchanging it for another in the hope that its legs don't twist."

product_title: Matsunichi Photoblitz PF-560 5.6-Inch Digital Picture Frame
review_body: I was very excited to receive my Matshunichi Photoblitz Digital  Frame.  However, the thrill QUICKLY wore off.  The overall image quality is quite poor.  Standing a foot from the image, you can see pixelation.  The frame really works best for viewing 5 or more feet away.  For a 5 inch frame, that isn't exactly ideal.  If you are interested in image quality, I would not recommend this frame.  However, if you're looking for a cheap digital picture frame and image quality isn't a huge issue, this is probably the frame for you.

product_title: Canon PowerShot A630 8MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom
review_body:
Aye, this camera is great. I suppose I might be biased, this being my first digital, but I have used cameras borrowed from pals in the recent past, and didn't particularly enjoy them (which is why I wasn't too interested in a digi before).

Quick startup is a big bonus. On my trip earlier this year, I missed many opportunities for good photos with my pal's HP camera, as it took a few seconds to boot, and seconds between photos. The only video I took had to be tossed due to the 15fps blurry quality (and he had no memory card). The digital zoom was horrible, and indoors photos were really crappy - especially at night.

The 30fps movie mode in the A630 is wonderful for a camera of this price - I never use the 15fps mode at all - it's blurry and the picture is 'jumpy,' although if it's done outdoors with good ambient lighting, it seems to work a bit better. I quickly learned to navigate the settings, being a complete novice, but I still need to check the manual on a couple of items that I have no idea about.

Even though it won't fit in my pocket and is heavier than many, the battery life is great. I have the camera over a month now, have taken video, stills with and without flash, deleted and re-shot stuff, and still have not changed the original batteries. If this were my pal's camera, I would have changed batteries after about 8 or so shots. Serious.

I bought a 2GB SD card for it, along with rechargeables and a charger. The only off-key thing I noticed so far is that the images can get pretty grainy on night-time zoomed indoor shots where incandescent (normal) light bulbs are used. As one other reviewer said, I don't know if I have to tinker with the settings to fix this, but that's the only issue I have had.

So basically these things do it for me with this camera:

- Excellent battery life - AA size is easy to get and keep for emergencies
- Excellent video capture with sound
- Quick boot and inter-shot response
- Excellent image quality with little or no blur
- Nice features such as color swap and pre-sets for common situations, apart from manual settings for more advanced users.
- Foldable vari-angle LCD is very very useful - the screen won't get damaged once it's folded in - unlike those with the screen showing at the back. This is great for evaluating your shots, and the quality is pretty good for a small screen.
- Image quality settings allow for maximized space utilization on you SD. (GET a 1-Gig or larger card!)

Drawbacks:

- Some grainy zoomed indoor shots (moreso in nighttime video capture)
- Larger than expected
- Haven't been able to find the correct carrying case up to December 2006! What?!
- Causes me to waste time instead of preparing for my exams! :)

Overall, an easy-to-use, excellent camera, straight out of the box. Would recommend it (and already did - 3 of my coworkers are ordering it, so Canon please organize my cut).

ML.

product_title: The Choice
review_body: This book is very touching, it tugged on the heart strings.  I love how it ended.  I can't wait to start reading his next book.

product_title: The Simple Living Handbook: Discover the Joy of a De-Cluttered Life
review_headline: Makes You Take A Second Look
review_body:
Honestly this book makes you do exactly what the title of this review says. It makes you take a second look, then a third, and then when you get to your twentieth look around your home you realize you have way more stuff than you need and it is actually the cause of some of the tension around the home.

This is a great tool for helping you find that inner peace, the happiness that comes with de-cluttering and minimalism. I constantly re-read chapters to see what other things I can do to try to get things out of my apartment. I have a large apartment for two people and it seems to still be filled with stuff. This helped me realize both me and my husbands inner pack rat and get rid of a lot of things.

Highly recommend it to anyone who is looking to make their life a little less hectic.

product_title: Welcome To The Zombie Hotel Sterling

review_body: so this was a cute, funny, beautiful love story. Kel is an \\\\\alibi\\\\\" which may seem stupid but if I had a person in high school who was an \\\\\"alibi\\\\\" I would have totally taken advantage of it! its sad though because she did it to fill a void if feeling wanted. her family never around, no true friends...not even Sadie if you ask me...though she did make up for the lack of support later on! then she met chase....oooooo I was totally swooning over this hunk....until they meantioned chest hair....not my thing but he was a total gentleman....super sweet and definantly in love! product_title: Blissfully Snowbound (Blissful, #1)
review_body:
Absolutely loved this book I could not put it down . You will fall in love with the characters and the story!!
Highly recommend you read!!!!

product_title: Undressed (The Manhattanites)
review_body:
Holy Coco Chanel! I had no idea what I was in for when I started this book. I stayed in a constant state of raised eyebrow unbelieving snorts throughout. I really loved Lex who is a successful fashion designer. I admired her smarts and her sass. She kept me laughing with quips like, "calm your kitty", and "earth to my muffin". I enjoyed her close relationship with her crazy friends who were fun and always had her back. It was interesting to take a ride on the fashion train as I experienced it from a Designer's point of view.

Masi, or Prince of Poo, as he was referred to by Lex's protective girlfriend, is a hottie. He is so hot that Lex named her BOB after after him when she saw him in the gossip magazines. She referred to him as being hot, hung, rich, and hard-bodied. The Prince is very formal and tries to keep his distance but life gets in the way and they are thrown together an forced to spend time together. At first I didn't believe their relationship and didn't feel their connection. I felt the sex scenes were over the top and some of the expressions distasteful. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE dirty talk and steamy sex. And there was plenty of that. By the end of the book I was convinced and very attached to the characters.

I enjoyed reading Undressed and I'm looking forward to reading Unscrupulous and all of the other books in the Manhattanites series. Avery Aster is a talented author, I like knowing that I can expect love, laughs, steamy sex, and a HEA with no fear of a cliffie.

product_title: Bound by Blood (Cauld Ane Book 1)
review_body: Very interesting, long enough to make it a good read and short enough to read in a couple of days.

product_title: Keeper of My Heart

This story is based on his experiences as he remembers them. An easy read, one you will want to stick with to the conclusion. His determination, dedication, and patriotism are a lesson for today.

Jeanette has a unique way of keeping the reader interested in her writings.
M. N.

review_body: I just finished this story. I enjoyed the spiritual references and emotional complexities of developing a relationship. It was an easy read.

product_title: Bullets Don't Die (The Loner series Book 15)
review_body: But why after all I have read so many of his books how can I not rate and be accurate.  I would bet, if you like the other ones I have rated you will like this one.  Of course some are slightly better, but always entertaining without suffering through books like taxes and legal.

product_title: In Stilettos (A Sexy, Sultry, Sassy Contemporary Romance Bundle)
review_body: Each of these books are thoroughly entertaining. In the first installment we meet Alec and Jaya who run into each other in an elevator when she is at the lowest point in her life. Before the end of the story Alec will take her to several high points! The chemistry between the two characters is very hot and a fantastic beginning for the series. The next book continues the story right where the previous book ended. This allows the reader to continue to live in the stilettos world even if it is just a fantasy. Speaking of fantasies, this is exactly what the next couple Beckett and Ricci create. It does not hurt that Beckett has the look of every woman's fantasy. This couple takes us around the world in 80 days with races, harems and fantasies too hot for a review. The final book includes Micca and Caleb. This book reminds the reader that we all have a past and may need help healing. Caleb's love for Micca has led him to a revelation that he will not wait any longer for Micca and the way he earns her trust and her body leaves the rest of us jealous! These books are well worth the price and I strongly recommend reading them with a cool drink in a hot bubble bath!

product_title: Dirty Red (Love Me With Lies Book 2)
review_body: There are not words for her, there are not names for, other then the devil herself.  Yes Caleb did some bad things, but Leah, what she has done is unforgivable.

product_title: Thomas Kinkade's Home for Christmas
review_body:
I really enjoyed this movie. The characters are believable, the paintings are beautiful. Worth the money I spent.
You won't be disappointed!

product_title: Last Light (The Restoration Series Book 1)
review_body: Not sure how this book got my attention; might have been a recommendation from Amazon or I just happend to surf their catalog and came across this book.  I bought it in kindle format so I got this immediately. At the time I was reading 2 other books; however, once I got into this book I couldn't stop flipping the kindle pages.  Fantastic read.  It was a genre of mystery, family gatherings, growing pains and faith all blended smoothly into one book. The book is so well written that I have a movie going on my mind each time I'm flipping the pages. Absolutely loves this book.

A fast paced action adventure describing heroic challenge's of a regrettable past and the price he paid Chasing gold

review_body: My 2 & 3.5 year olds just go to read this on our Kindle Fire H, and they hollered out the answers to each question. Loved it.

product_title: Another View
review_body: I was thrilled that Rosamunde Pilchers books are finally on kindle. But, I think the prices are high. Since some of them are just short stories. Lower your prices Amazon and I will buy more.

review_body: This book is thought provoking and demonstrates how even good people can make life altering mistakes.  The most valuable lesson it demonstrates is that there is grace for all of us no matter who we are.  It further shows how taking personal responsibility can bring about the beginning of healing.

product_title: TRASH TO TREASURE - HOW YOU CAN SELL ANYTHING ONLINE AND MAKE MONEY
review_headline: Good Book for Online Selling Beginners
review_body: Great book for those just starting out in the online selling world. I found this book to be informative and helpful! Thanks!

product_title: Holywood Star: The Life and Times of a Rock and Roll Misadventurer
review_headline: Off the Rails - In a Good Way!
review_body: Holywood Star has turned out to be one of the best Rock autobiographies I've ever had the good fortune to stumble over. It stands in the same league with Diary of a Rock-n-Roll Star, the Dirt, and Full Moon - I kid you not. The writing is laugh-so-hard-you-wake-the-spouse-and-scare-the-pets hilarious. I read in bed while my husband sleeps and there were many times I had to clap my hand over my mouth to keep from shrieking out loud at some of the anecdotes. How Eamonn Nancarrow managed to live the full-on Rock and Roll experience and manage to keep all of his limbs, I don't know. From hard partying, to run-ins with skinheads, to brushes with sectarian violence, he somehow lived to tell the tale, and I'm so glad he did. The best and the worst of human nature is here, captured in 350 pages of brutally honest, Father Ted-meets-Spinal Tap awesomeness. This one will be a keeper on my Kindle for a long time to come.

product_title: The Husband's Secret
review_body: I really enjoyed this book. Unpredictable story line. The writing felt very authentic as Sid the characters. Loved the epilogue!

product_title: If I Stay (If I Stay, Book 1)
review_body: Absolute perfection. This is probably this best book I have read in my entire career as a journalist. It is absolutely amazing. Bravo.

product_title: Shadow of Love
review_body: First the story line was great however the ages in the story dont add up for one. I always calculate the years and they didnt match. There were to much details that i found myself skipping pages just way to much. Also Sophie never showed any remorse for what she did that just ticked me off even with her past. Also Emily never told James she loved him unless that was one of the parts i skipped but he said it in the end. The end felt rushed. So i have this book a three star rating. It could have been better.

product_title: The Fault in Our Stars
review_headline: It did remind me of my daughter Christina
review_body:
I learned about Fault of Our Stars when my daughter's friend posted on FB that the main character reminded him of Christina. Intrigued, I read the book. I discovered a fresh, down to earth portrayal of a 16-year-old cancer patient's observations and reflections about her experience.

This is a beautifully written book: funny, poignant, and insightful. It did remind me of things Christina would have said.

For those of you that think, this kind of thing doesn't really happen in real life. I was one of you before my daughter died. And truly, things like this do happen.

product_title: 51 Metabolism Boosting Foods: How To Lose Weight Fast By Eating Foods That Boost Your Metabolism and Burn Fat Naturally (Fat Burning Foods Book 2)
review_body: Many of these sound very delicious and the few ive tried I love! Some are a little off for my tastebuds but for the most part they all seem at least worth a try

product_title: Lost Legion [A Robert Sable Mystery]
review_body:
An interesting mix of characters, bringing together the Native Alaskans and the twentieth century.

The description of Anchorage and Eagle River is excellent. After returning to UK after three months in the area it is an added bonus to be able to recognise from the description all the different neighbourhoods.
Excellent mix of legend and fact with an insight to the Alaskan Trooper organisation.

An excellent entertaining read

I want to know how the prince and his brother cope with present day and their relationships ! Please I beg you please write a sequel ! It's definitely a must read!

product_title: Online Dating:: Finding Love Online: Discover The Essential Guide for Smart Singles: Online Dating for Men, Online Dating for Women, Online Dating Sparks ... Dating Strategies, Dating Advice Book 1)
review_headline: If you are single, you must read this!
review_body: Well, I'm married and I'm a woman, therefore I'm not exactly somebody who would normally buy this book. I actually downloaded it for free and had a look at it out of curiosity. I think it's really a must for any single man. What Nick Stevens says about women (for example what women watch out for in men), is completely true. Recommended!

product_title: Pulse
review_body:
*I was gifted an e-copy of the book in exchange for an honest review*
I liked that Esa was a tough cookie shaped by the rough life on the streets however I had a little trouble placing her as I must have missed the info on how old she was. There is a difference in behavior between a 14 year old and an 18 year old so I couldn't really figure her out in certain situations.

Rootu was getting on my nerves quickly. Everything seemed a game for him and was getting Esa in trouble because of it. And I hated how he could influence her mind to submit to his wishes. That's why I had trouble understanding some of Esa's actions because I didn't know the reason why she was doing it. She all of a sudden felt the need to help and protect Rootu even though she knew him only days. Was it some kind of connection she felt or was he influencing her mind? It was these little details that somewhat irritated me.

The novel is beautifully written and it flows effortlessly. The characters are well presented and you can easily get a taste of their personality. I was annoyed by the constant conflict in Esa though where she felt a warning but kept doing things anyway which kind of felt like it was against her character as she was described as a child of the streets that is only looking to survive the day. And I didn't really get a feel of this post-apocalyptic world. If it wasn't for a couple of random mentions of it, I could easily place the story in some fantasy world that has nothing to do with post-apocalypse.

product_title: Melody in Lingerie (BDSM Erotica)
review_body: Melody is a closet submissive. While shopping in a lingerie store, she is approached by a man who asks her to model some lingerie he wishes to purchase. When she agrees, she gets more than she bargained for.

product_title: Scare Me
review_headline: I'm trying to sit comfotably after finishing this book (not scared but bothered)
review_body:
It was a good read. I thought that a lot of the background took away from the overall story. But the murders were spot-on (more than made up for the negatives produced in the novel). Nothing different than any of the other readers put into their reviews (too long at parts, characters were seldom mentioned making the twist ending less of a twist). The one problem I had was with Tam. This child being 6 years old really got to me. Thinking realistically, I can't 100% believe that a 6yr old would do and think half the things that this boy did. It really bothered me and took away from the story. Maybe I'm being nit-picky and maybe the movie will show me the errors of my thoughts.
Anywho, it is a good book with plenty of blood and gore and unique kills, the antagonist is just crazy enough to make interesting. Eager to see how Parker can learn from his mistakes and produce a sequel.

product_title: Plain Jane: A mystery/thriller not for the faint of heart (The Harbinger Murder Mystery Series Book 1)
review_body: Just when you think you have figured it out another twist. A little more Gore than I read but a good read just the same

product_title: Outlander: A Novel (Outlander, Book 1)
review_body: Could not put it down, can't wait to finish the series but will have to pace myself as I don't want to do anything but read the adventures of Claire and Jamie. I find myself lost in their world and became a time traveler along with Claire!

product_title: The Light Between Oceans
review_body:
During the aftermath of World War One, Tom Sherbourne decides that for the rest of his life, he only wants to cause good and not harm. For that reason, he applies for the job of lighthouse keeper at remote Janus Island in Western Australia, situated where the Indian and Southern Oceans meet. He'll have plenty of time to ponder and may help save ships from being wrecked. Little does he know he'll soon find himself in a horrible position in which causing happiness for one woman will result in unspeakable grief for another, and vice versa.

Allowing his beloved wife, Isabel, to keep the child she deeply loves, and who seemed to be washed to their shore by providence means sentencing the baby's birth mother, Hannah, to a lonely life of heartache and forever unanswered questions.

Although my heart ached for each of the three adults, I grieved most for little Lucy. When I was little, I used to dread being taken away from my parents, who meant stability and all the world to me. Her confusion and pain was heartbreaking to read. Is this story about the eventual resilience of the human spirit, or would being the subject of this horrific predicament have scarred her for the long term more than the end of the book seems to indicate? I really don't know.

Spoiler Alert

I guess some readers may call the ending 'realistic' and others may say that it constitutes a 'literary' rather than 'popular' ending. Still, I would've liked it if twenty years hadn't lapsed before any contact was made. It seemed like a final cruel twist that Lucy eventually showed up one week after Isabel's death. It is definitely a book to help readers treasure those sweet, monotonous times with our own children.

review_body: What a disappointment. After reading the previous books in the series I expected an easy read. This book had every predictable and ridiculous problem you could encounter.
